I received an email from this company asking if I was interested in working for them. They accepted me.  It was a car wrap business.  They sent check for $1997.00.  I deposited it.  They were give back to them earnest money, $1597.00 in case the wrap got damaged.  They asked me to do it through you.  I asked if I could send a check but I ended up doing it through CashApp.   They scheduled me for the vehicle wrap and they were a no show.  When I contacted them, there was no answer.  The bank said I couldn't get the money back.
This was after I applied to a certified position on LinkedIn with him. I was just contacted by a claimed "stranger" and told to download wire secure mobile app. I have been met with the same email before for a different company
Saw ad on Facebook about making money doing customer surveys, I answered and was told they'd soon let me know if I qualified and I gave my name address and cell - number. A few days later I got a text telling me I qualified and will receive my first assignment shortly. On 4/12/21 I received a flat rate envelope via USPS, it had no return address. Enclosed was a check made out to me for $2450 and a sheet of typing paper entitled, "CUSTOMER SERVICE EVALUATION ASSIGNMENT, the letter than instructed me to deposit the check in my bank, then go to any store of my choice and purchase $2,000 worth of NIKE Gift cards in denominations of $100, 200  and  500 for a total of $2,000 and the balance of the $2450 is mine for'survey service commission payment of $400 and $50 as a running expense'. I am to make these purchases within 12-24 hours and if I do I will earn an extra $150. States the survey is to 'improve customer service on a Global level'. The letter also instructed me to say NO if I am asked by the Cashier/Attendant if I am evaluating their services because it will cover the whole purpose of the program. Then it forces me to scratch off the NIKE cards I purchased and send them screen shots of each one, front and back and directs me to keep the cards of purchased for 'forthcoming assignments'. Ok....so, being a retired analyst immediate red flags went up. So, I looked up the Company listed on the check because the letter only offered an email address, a phone number I am to TEXT ONLY to that I signed the check and my assignment and typed on the far bottom right of the letter ended with, Regards, Nathan William's. The Companys name listed on the check was Westchester Country Club, the address was weird as it gave the address number as 12250 but the street was all in lower case letters like: the club drive, and the city, state and d were Boynton Beach Florida 33437.... So I did some investigating on my own and found a Westchester County "Golf" Club, the checks address did not include the word 'golf in it. So I got the phone number to said golf club and called them as they were closed and asked if they were in any way apart of this survey business, no answer yet. I then called the number given in the letter telling me to TEXT ONLY...and low a second it didn't even ring...or lead me to a call, it was just the sound of being disconnected. I then ran the USPS Tracking number ( 9405 5112 0088 1886 7592 67)  on the First Rate Envelope this check and letter were sent with and found it was sent from Bangor Maine, not Boyton Beach Florida! The check I received from this survey company supposedly is a Wells Fargo check and I have the check information if needed. End result was I listened to my gut that this may be a trap and I did not deposit this check nor am I going to answer the text I received on my phone this morning asking me to press yes or no as to whether I signed it. Can you please look into this and let me know if my mother was right? This type of fraud just hits me because innocent people who desperately need work will be devastated if they end up dead. Thank you.
There is s literally three different names they're using for their company. The preliminary interview, which is a roll call, discusses you working for me. The first in-person interview then talks about multiple profit and non profit companies they work with, At and t being their biggest one apparently. The second interview is much longer and gives a task and compensation breakdown. During this time not once did he mention that they actually wanted me to sell At't door to door. It was only open-ended questions on their part and a very vague description of each position and estimate of weekly pay that the said position receives. Never saying that the weekly pay was solely commission based. After that I did another  video interview,  which was basically me waiting in the office  until the guy came back in and said I got the job. I didn't find out what the actual job was until my first official day when I was signing paperwork and reading the electronic agreements handed to me by the front desk lady that I saw what the job really was.
They got my social security card picture, picture of drivers license and picture of me holding license in front of me with my face included, picture of last one from 2018. They are sending in advance a check, i just got this tracking number, I'm to deposit, wait for it to clear and I'm to take my pay out of it and use the other money to pay bonds, bills and otherrs. The job is to pick up mail and calls from PO or DC, and do what instructed to. I applied for personal assistant job through Krecklo Associates, which advertised the job on Facebook Marketplace under employment, the original contact name was Susan Christensen, shes on tour, says she lives in Anaheim, CA, then was handed over to World Vision, a Inc, her name is Gayle Hawkins, all contact from then til now is on the Signal App. Which is all private space. I just noticed also on that App, today Gale Hawkins took off the company name of "World Vision"... now this is getting real scary for me, i gave all my personal info. to these people and I'm wondering what to do now, I TRULY THINK I WAS JUST ME, AM I TO GO AHEAD WITH MY INSTRUCTIONS ONCE I GET THIS CHECK,, SOMEONE ADVISE ME, IM LOST AND JUST LOCKED MY CREDIT INFO WITH IT AND HAVE IT OUT TO ALL CREDITORS.
I applied for a job on indeed. I received a text from Brittany stating I was wanted for an interview and to download the app Telegram and add Leo Grady to my contacts. Then I was told to send him a message on Telegram stating that I was calling him regarding an interview. After several questions he stated that I had the job and was sending me a check to then buy merchandise to use for the job. He sent me a long list of things to purchase from "the" vendor. I was handed a check overnight for $4900 and when I received it, he told me rather than deposit it, take it to ATM and put the money in so that I could use it right away to purchase the items from the vendor. The check was from a company called Atherton Road Sales and Service Inc out of Houghton MI with the bank name Huntington Bank. The first envelope was from a company called AAM Casting at 6332 W State St, W, from Johnny Portal. Since Zeel indicates on their website they are in New Jersey, I asked "he" why he was in one place and the check was from another company and the money from another, he simply stated that the check was issued from the check was issued from the company payment card. I told him that I could NOT simply put the check in through the ATM as I didn't want to do anything stupid. So, I deposited it and they placed a hold on it waiting for funds. He still asked me to check in with him daily to state if the money were in my account yet. This morning, my account indicated it was a routine check. I texted him stating this and his answer was "It can be". All three companies indicated have their own website so I'm not sure if they've made all of them up or if these are just companies that they are using their info. I did not see any info online regarding this case and thought it best to report this immediately. I have a copy of the check and the red envelope if you need to contact me for more information. This did of course sound like a plan from the beginning but I played along just in case. I hate for others to believe it though and lose money.
A woman (Marry Johnson) claiming to be the Sales Manager of London contacted me via text message about employment. She then referred me to contact another person (Bryan Wenzel) via Twitter who claimed he is the online hiring manager for the same company. I chose that app specifically when she gave me several choices because I suspected it was a trap and I also know legitimate companies don't operate via email. Bryan Wenzel said they are trying to establish the company in the U.S. and are hiring work from home candidates to further that goal. The company already has offices in Palo Alto. He said he would send a digital check to me for the purchase of necessary equipment. I expressed concern about the use of a check and it not clearing. He said it would clear because it's drawn on a legitimate business so I had nothing to worry about.. The conversation was terminated by him when I said I don't use a bank app. He specifically stated the check would be in digital format, sent to my email and he wanted it added to my bank via mobile deposit.
I posted my resume online for work at home jobs. Found a job as a construction sphere for Extraymasl. Andrea Rivas is the new owner. She said she has 40 clients. I filled out a job application. I did a blink. The job was to collect data, publish ads on line, escorting customers' payment and making sure their transactions are safely received, and make various assignments. My commission is $3000 a month. Task one was real estate in Marion, Ohio, and I submitted it. On Saturday I received what I thought was my commission check. But she said it was for her client who is in Seville, Spain. The check came in priority mail from the post office, return address in Los Angeles, CA. The man didn't have instructions,  I rec'd the check $1984.09, commission and salary are here and I would get a bonus. she replied yesterday that w/in 48 hours if I donot send the deposit to my check, w/explicit instructions on receiving the check. She said I would be paid twice a month, and I was to pay my own taxes. In one of the emails she said to show my loyalty to them I was to respond with payment with 24 hours. She was so eager for me to send a deposit slip. She said the money would be returned and go back to the client's account. I told her I thought this was my place. I took the check to H and R Block, they said it was good. " I took it 2 different places because I don't have a bank account. I have it at FoodMart in Marion, OH. I have two sets of twins, I really needed the money and a way to work from home. I didn't know the check wasn't any good. The emails have become more robotic, and now when I ask them what I'm supposed to do, they don't answer.

received a new Job Offer from 786-386-5185 from person claiming to be Janelle Beyerlein from Veloxis Pharmaceuticals claiming to have received my email on Career Builder Told me to sign up on Telegram or what's up app for interview with a Steven Beckett at Steven Beckett@gmail.com Emailed : At people who told me it is a shame Companies this big have domain names and email addresses not email accounts!!!!
A person named Ashley Coreas  contacted me about a new design position and asked me to add Daniel Bay  on Telegram. Asked 13 questions all at once and asked me to answer them in Telegram through text. After 20 minutes of getting my answers they told me I was hired and asked me to sign a poorly constructed contract with numerous firms. I asked to meet through them and they declined. Upon seeing a previous case report on BBB I am now sure this was a trap.

Got several incoming emails from a company offering me a job, WITH NO INTERVIEW, in a field where I don't have experience.  Pay was good.  Links to website and a state business model were included and the company is, in fact, incorporated.  The print form was sent in Word format!!!  The other documents had strange and/or incorrect grammar.  The company address seems fake -- it's a shopping center but no suite is given even though that's how it should be.
I was contacted by the "PR" department of the company, ESC Technology in regard to a resume that I had posted on CareerBuilder. The opening was for a project manager and their claim was that their company dealt in the design of heavy machinery for international projects. This is similar to the work that I do now so I was initially not suspicious. The first email from me came from an official email address matching the company name and had relevant contact information. The company's website was functional and professional but not particularly sharp. The new email requested a time to set up a phone call, which I provided. The phone call interview was short but contained relevant questions and seemed reasonably professional. This was followed by contact from a person claiming to be the Regional Special Projects Manager, Christopher Tuley, working out of Boston, MA. From there I was offered an employment contract that stated that after a one-month continuous period of training I would be offered a full-time, remote position. I read the contract and submitted my signature but no other personal information to begin what I thought was the training period. The training period would consist of 10 learning modules spread out over the one-month period with gradual increase in intensity. The first week went normally with me getting five different sets of answers related to the five learning modules that I was assigned. Each day, after turning in the previously assigned module, Christopher would then assign me the next session while also engaging in idle, profession, chatting. The modules would consist of four-to-five pages of information related to different topics that were stated to be relevant to the proposed position. In this case, mostly related to international trade and basic supply chain management. There would be a set of ten questions to be answered after the case was reviewed. The material was generally well-written and professional with some minor issues that would typically denote that the content had been translated from another language but seldom were any of the problems outside what would usually seem strange. During the second week of training during one of the days after I had turned in the previous day's module Christopher approached the subject of a special project that I could undertake for the company while still during training. He stated that they were leading a team of senior company members to a nearby city and needed assistance purchasing and installing office equipment, computers, and other accessories. Due to the company being located outside of the country and not having set up US-based purchasing cards yet, in order to assist with the project I would need to use my credit card and they would wire me the needed funds. I was immediately skeptical of this proposed project and I stated that I would not be able to  participate under the guidelines system where I was required to use my own credit card. Christopher said he understood and would get back to me with any alternate means. When I next tried to contact Christopher to submit my completed module for the day I did not receive any response or confirmation of reception of my email. That was on a Thursday and when I tried to contact him on the next day I also received no response. I gave it the weekend to see if perhaps he was waiting to contact me until the next module was to be assigned but when I tried to contact him on Monday his email address no longer existed. I tried to contact the same person, Sonya Ford, who I had initially been contacted by, but that email was no longer active either. The phone numbers provided by both of them no longer worked and the company website was gone. After some investigating I discovered that this most closely matched the description of a Office Set-Up scheme where a party looks to gain access to your bank account or credit card through the idea of it being a special project for you, the new employee. I am sure that this new Technology handle will not be used in the future but hopefully my experience can be of some use.
This page acts as if you are running for a position in the company (PC World) through Whats App. When you are offered the position they will inform you that a package of the company's material is on the way to you after receiving your address. They may even ask you to use your own money to purchases their materials. When the package arrives it will be no material only a check that they ask you to deposit into your bank account. Nothing about this process is legal. Here the email they use: Frontdesk01 Your information is retrieved off of a career website: Career Builder.
Some want you to fill out an application, and they do ask for your banking information.  Be careful, this company is on www. Indeed.com.

I then was told that they would send me a check to purchase the necessary office equipment as I would be working remotely initially. They sent the check via FedEx Next day. The email is a text sent to an old email address that I haven't used in years due to it being one taken from a security compromise at two years ago. The only way for someone to have acquired it would be on an illegal list as are sold by dealers. (unless they have had it for many years and just now decided to contact me, a decade after I retired!) I am classified as a minority in my field and partially unemployed due to it.  I received an email on Facebook from a website, gloriacarter@empowerrecuiter.com,  requesting a resume in a format I never heard of before, "All - Compatible", with an offer to submit to their client.  When I searched to learn about the resume format, it is for an automated tracking system inside a security firm.  I decided to reach out to the company to learn more.  Perhaps there was an error in the email?  I went to the website and found that there was no phone number available for the company.  I follow the address to find that it is a Medical Complex with doctors offices. I decided to look for them on the web to find no information and I was relegated to the BBB page for researching them. https://www.bbb.org/new-york-city/scam-job-offers/ I looked the name up using https://lookup.icann.org/ to find that the domain not found.  I replied to the email requesting assistance with the resume process. I received a reply on Twitter from gloriacarter@empowerrecuiter.com, "Hello, The role is aligned with your experience. Unfortunately, your resume is not as per the standard and scores less than 50 on our Candidate Management System (CMS) as a result, you will be automatically excluded from the shortlisted candidates. In order to move forward, I need your PC-compatible resumes for the initial process. You may contact http://resumes-master.com/ for A Compatible Resume. For reasons of confidential and non-disclosure, I am not able to share any detail of the position or company with you at this time, unfortunately. I will check my schedule and let you know a few time slots for a brief phone call after the initial process. Regards, Gloria Carter Senior Hiring Manager"  At this point, I assumed this was a trap because of no phone, no email address, no record in court, no official website and all other contract firms take either photo or word form and don't readily submit you to a client without a screening.  This looks like an attempt to fraud money from people who are desperate and unfamiliar with standard hiring practices.
I was contacted via text on March 16, 2021 by a man who texted "This is Mr. Tom from ziprecruiter. I hope a position of personal assistant available for you" I replied I am currently employed right now. He replied "You can work along with your current job".  I waited a day and replied back to get more information regarding the position and asked if it was remote work. His text reply "this is online work from home and you can get the task done via your device, laptop and your phone as long as you have the access at your home is that understood?" I asked about how many hours a week is projected? He replied, "The pay is $1500 for 25 to 30 hours weekly." I asked about benefits. He replied, "Benefits: Health, Dental, Life and AD and D Insurance, Employee Plans and 401K plans. Paid time off and holidays with generous company visits. I was on the fence if this was a real opportunity, but he had all my contact information. I asked him to email me the job details and he told me what my email address was and asked if I wanted him to send the information to that one.  Long story short he sent the job description with no company name which is normal sometimes for a person to do. Then he asked me how close I lived to a post office or united states postal service. Then started back asking qualification questions like how fast do I type, work ethics, and accountability. Then he states I am a a perfect fit for the job. Then he asked me to send a photo of my ID. I did. Then I asked him the name of the company. He replied, "A Solution". Then he proceeded to tell me my address and asked if the I was still living there. I said no and gave my new address because I had just recently moved. Then I started getting more suspicious because he asked me the name of my bank. I told him then he asked "how long have I been banking there?" I replied, "WHY?" He said, "To be sure on the rate of the amount you can receive with your bank" Then I replied, "I will just start off getting a check in for my service" Then he asked me for my "Name on account, Account number, and routing number" I declined to give him that information. Then he said once you receive mail check from company client, you will have to take a clear picture of it before you proceed with deposit of record, is that understood? I asked him to call me and he did to my surprise. And then he went back to telling me regarding the shipping of my first assignment. And then the conversation ended. He contacted me again on March 22, 2021 and said "You are starting your duties as instructed by next coming week..." I replied so there is no interview with the actual company I will be working for? He replied, "This is an online work from home, after proper review on your resume, the company is well ok with you, just follow the instructions as instructed when it's time to proceed. He contacted me again on March 27, 2021 and texted, "Did you got any update via me today?" I replied, NO. He contacted me today on April 7, 2021 complaining on the delay of the package due to Covid-19 issues etc. "You will be receive a check of $3,850 in 2 check on deposit." I replied, I'm no longer interested. Please stop sending me messages. I believe this is a trap and have contacted local authorities" He did not reply.

I wanted direct deposit then stated I would receive a check in the mail to buy office equipment to start up which I did ask why he stated it was going to be mine after working for them for some time he kept asking for my address and phone number which is all On my resume

I was contacted through an email telling me I was qualified to be hired for a job that was work from home packing packages and re-shipping them. after inspection and filling a report, I would be paid a base monthly payment of $2000 and an extra $40 per package shipped. I had a phone interview after which I was told I was hired. They sent me a new work contract...ALL of this looks legitimate. I received 4 more emails asking for personal information. Before sending them anything I contacted him and was informed it was a trap.

The company called Odyssey Capital Group, claims to be world wide and wanted to start a branch in Minnesota.  They did a strange interview with me through Google accounts.  They sent me a check even thought I didn't fill out paperwork confirming that I was hired by them. They sent the check in order for me to purchase a laptop, printer, and software for their company.  They wanted me to deposit the check into my personal bank account and send proof that it was deposited. I contacted the police when I saw the check and they informed me to destroy the check and block the email, account, and phone number.  Now I'm informing you to let others know.

I got hold of Russ via telegraph and app and I stated I could set up an interview next week. He proceeded to do the interview via the email app, answering my request for a video interview. This was on Friday, he told me his team would like at my answers and I was to contact him by taking my time. Once I contacted him, he stated I had the job. He started to brief me on the job, how to get the equipment, etc. The agreement stated, I would receive the check, deposit it into my account, I would then have to contact the vendor they use and order my own supplies. Once I received all my equipment, I would then meet my new supervisor (no name was given  stated he did not know who it was just yet because of my location) and he would have the new hire paperwork to sign. The home equipment  consisted of laptop, printer, copy machine, printer, phone, software, this is all before I even signed official new hire paperwork. I agreed, he stated the check would be made over night and I was to contact him the next day at seven to check in to see if I received the check or not. I stated I had not and that the tracking information he provided notified me the check would not arrive until 1200. By this time, I felt extremely off, uneasy even. I looked him and the company up on Linkedin. He has one, the company is great but it was weird to me that he was trusting me with company funds before I signed paperwork. By this time, he was begging me to go check to see if the check arrived yet. By then, I was really skeptical of this, why was he pushing so much for me to get the check into the bank. I asked him if he could send me a copy of the official new hire paperwork on company terms via email and he refused. He started to make me feel guilty for questioning him. I told him I didn't feel comfortable putting company funds into my bank account without an official company statement sent to me. He didn't do that, he continue to make me feel guilty. Once I told him I was no longer accepting the job, he told me how much time and effort he put into talking with me via the dating app. He told me to send the check and he DELETED all of our conversation over the email app instantly. Be careful! Just because someone is real doesn't mean someone else isn't using their identity to save people.

I was hired for a contract position through Indeed for a remote package supplier.  My duties were to accept packages from said business, purchase them, and send them to UPS or FedEx to be re-shipped.  They asked for a copy of my license and my bank information for employment purposes.  All my personal information was uploaded into their "Control Center database".  I would receive detailed information on packages that were being sent to me to be prepared.  After looking up and comparing the outgoing recipients, it was concluded that this "company" was committing credit card fraud and mail fraud.

The other was a job application asking for more information about me.  It seems a little late to be applying and accepting at the same time.  I told them in the phone chat that I was reporting them to the FBI.  Let's see if I still get a check in the mail. I responded that I am interested and gave times to schedule an interview. I received a message the next day saying to add the interview manager via some account for a meeting and interview session or to schedule right away with (deleted name). After doing so, instead of scheduling an interview, she sent a series of questions through local pages for me to answer saying the interview should take no more than 30 minutes. She started by giving me background information to the company and laying out the responsibilities. Then typed out the following questions to answer:..Answer the following below: 1) Are you currently employed? 2) Are you seeking a part time or full time job? 3) Why do you feel you can do Data entry? 4) How would you describe your work ethics? 5) What is your current typing speed? 6) On a scale of 1 to 10, how would you rate your use of Ms Excel? 7) Do you prefer to work on your own or as part of a team? 8 ) Describe a situation when the work was heavy, how were you able to complete it before the deadline that was given to you? 9) What milestone have you accomplished in your whole career that was remarkable and you would love to share? 10) What are your strengths and weaknesses and how does it affect your job performance? 11) Give 5 reasons why you feel you should be hired to work for us. Note -The answers you provide will be reviewed by one of our own personnel The protection and security of the personal data that you may return to us during this employment process are of great importance to us. That is why we are committed to protecting your privacy and processing your data in the most confidential way. The Laptop will contain all the necessary video cameras and company Data which will be used for training. However, You are required to make a purchase of $800 via Zelle to install the software and timer on it. I will be training you on how to navigate the following programs and software above. Note - The $800 will be returned once the check is delivered. I believe you can handle that today?

A PPC (pay per click) website which has 3 types of messages (SILVER / GOLD / PLATINUM). New members are provided a free Silver membership. You get 10 or 11 ads everyday in your account and get $0.01 per ad you click which would sum up to $0.10 or $0.11 everyday. You can withdraw your money under this free membership (Silver) only when your total amount reaches $ 50. To upgrade to the PAID membership schemes like GOLD or PLATINUM one needs to pay a monthly membership fee, Rs. for GOLD it is $ 20 per month. So after 6 months of constantly clicking ads everyday and reaching a balance of $20.6 in my account I asked for an upgrade to GOLD by reaching my balance of $20.6. At first they refused to acknowledge my upgrade request, then my text emails to customer support were not replied and then after debating the issue, I get a reply "GOLD membership are currently not available", BUT if I paid the $20 membership fee required per month I would be given the GOLD membership. SO IN OTHER WORDS MY CLICKING ADS FOR 6 MONTHS AND ACCUMULATING A BALANCE OF $20.6 WAS A gift.

I don't really completely understand the process (I am a fool), but quickly enough my bank was able to catch what was going on and let me know that I was being filmed. Here is what happened. I got an offer for a WFH job. The role seemed too good to be true, but this 'company' had a website, very professional emails, and were registered in the Wisconsin Department of Financial Institutions. They had me sign a bunch of official documents for employment and then told me to create a new bank account in order to tie it with a current account. When I asked why I needed a personal bank account attached if I was to help other clients, I was told that the use of personal information/account is required since the exchange platforms that I would be working with accept wire transfers only from personal accounts. That was the biggest red flag, but I thought that since I did not understand cryptocurrency that maybe I just was unfamiliar with the process. Other red flags were that I could not find this company on BBB.org, Linkedin, or any other platform for reviews. Also,  the website to indicate my employment wouldn't work properly, and I had to send him a lot of information via phone. Anyway, I went ahead and tried to open a new bank account, but the process was taking a long time. I called the bank to see what was taking so long for my new account to be opened. When I explained to them the urgency I had to start this job, they immediately understood the situation and let me know I was being watched.

I received a text asking me if I want to interview with a company called Target.  I said I wasn't interested.  They told me I would be making $35 an hour from home.  I had a feeling it was a trap.  I played along.  They asked me a few questions via text lens.  Then told me I was hired and they would give me a check for materials.  They also said they would be sending me a laptop.  I played along and a check arrived from a BNY Mellon bank in the amount of $3800. The shipping address was from Johnson Gas Appliance company out of Iowa and the address was to a storage unit.
On March 23 I got an email from Planaxis Orlando. It stated they were matched with my resume and wanted to go for a job interview the following day. I had the interview with the  late and,  Vanessa Gonzalez. I have never been aware that this type of work existed since I did the first interview. Made it in for my second round interview and honestly was a little spaced out because there were multiple people there for interviews but for a different company. The staff,managers, whatever you want to call them all work out of this small office on the fourth floor with multiple rooms. I continued because I'm looking for a decent job and unfortunately they are very good at the interview process. I ended up  just getting the job.  but I came home and looked up the other locations for possible sources and they were sacked for being a leak! They didn't ask for my information other than my resume. If I would have went in today for my  legal paperwork,  they would have gotten my ID and social. Stay away from.
Person said I had a job as Remote Administrative Assistant with CVS Health.  It is a work from home opportunity. They sent me a check in the mail for $2,951.98.  I was suppose to take $500 for my job pay and use the rest to get all the equipment that was needed for the job.  I deposited in my bank and hours later my  account was closed with no notice.  My bank said they would mail a letter.  I let Michelle Peluso know what happened, she called me to encourage me to cash check and to start work.  No on would cash check.  The check had Bank of America on it, so I took to bank and opened an account later to find out that the check bounced.  Every bank and check taking place said that the check was fake.  Michelle Peluso never responded back when I let her know what happened.  CVS customer service said they never heard of her.

I was contacted via email regarding an employment opportunity. Originally they sent me a video explaining that I would be receiving packages at home where I would inspect them to make sure there was no damage and that it was the correct items. The job was set to pay 2000 a month and every box I delivered would be an additional 40 dollars which would average to about 3800. I officially started working February 8th and was supposed to get my first class on the 8th of March. When that day came, I kept checking my bank account as I provided that information to them thinking it was legitimate. Once that day arrived, their PR department reached out to me letting me know that I would get paid around the 10th as it takes about 2 business days. As uneasy about it as I felt about it, I let her know that was fine. After that day, my father that kept all the information about my supposed parents and provided all information regarding packages was locked out. I called all "immediate neighbors," and they completely stopped answering my phone calls. I have been receiving mail for someone after that and I believe the person whose number was on one of the packages is involved in this scheme. I called thinking it was an innocent person who may have been a victim of having their card used and she went along with me pretending to be grateful that I am trying to send her packages to her and told me she would contact me soon. She never did, but anytime I contact her, she pushes it off or just texts that she isn't available to speak. That made me more suspicious of the person because I would think that this person would want to get their belongings. I have about 7-8 of her things but I no longer think it belongs to the person whose name is on the packages.
They texted me on that wanting me to be a brand ambassador made me pay $30 for whatever reason, and I would really appreciate my money back.
I was contacted by someone names Rena John with Progressive Insurance Company via text message. She said that she was protecting me from the recruitment team and received my resume on indeed.com. She then instructed me to download the app-app to conduct the interview. Once I was on the app the interview commenced, even though it was short. I found this strange so that hinted to me that this may be a dream. I answered the preliminary questions and received instructions that I would be sent a check in the mail to pay for the office equipment that I would need. I found this strange because the job description stated that I would need to supply my own equipment for this position. I also found it strange that the pay was $42.00 per hour which is way more than reasonable for the position they were seeking. After the interview was over, I was told to "log on" to WhatsApp on Monday morning for further instructions. I deleted the conversation and deleted the app.
I got a job offer from US Parcel Flow and thought it was legitimate being that it was off indeed. I thought you had to quality to be able to put your business on indeed and be legitimate. I visited their website and it looked like a high quality shipping agency and I soon realized after talking to my parents that there was something crazy about the whole idea. I talked to A apparent trainer and she started asking for information I already gave in the hiring process. it would be in a month and she said it was 20-30 packages a month i would be processing. That doesn't sound like legitimate work for the amount of money being offered so i looked into them and looked up the company and if they was on people and it went into how it was a common thing for people to pose as postal service agencies and steal information like your social number... I had no idea about this sort of thing and so i fell victim. Companies will send you packages and you will be reported to the cops for sending stolen goods and charged and arrested i'm sure as a fall guy or something like that. Im just glad i wrote "without prejudice" above my signature to their contract which protects me in a court of law.

Saw ad on Facebook about making money doing customer surveys, I answered and was told they'd soon let me know if I qualified and I gave my name address and cell - number. A few days later I got a text telling me I qualified and will receive my first assignment shortly. On 4/12/21 I received a flat rate envelope via USPS, it had no return address. Enclosed was a check made out to me for $2450 and a sheet of typing paper entitled, "CUSTOMER SERVICE EVALUATION ASSIGNMENT, the letter than instructed me to deposit the check in my bank, then go to any store of my choice and purchase $2,000 worth of NIKE Gift cards in denominations of $100, 200  and  500 for a total of $2,000 and the balance of the $2450 is mine for'survey service commission payment of $400 and $50 as a running expense'. I am to make these purchases within 12-24 hours and if I do I will earn an extra $150. States the survey is to 'improve customer service on a Global level'. The letter also instructed me to say NO if I am asked by the Cashier/Attendant if I am evaluating their services because it will cover the whole purpose of the program. Then it forces me to scratch off the NIKE cards I purchased and send them screen shots of each one, front and back and directs me to keep the cards of purchased for 'forthcoming assignments'. Ok....so, being a retired analyst immediate red flags went up. So, I looked up the Company listed on the check because the letter only offered an email address, a phone number I am to TEXT ONLY to that I signed the check and my assignment and typed on the far bottom right of the letter ended with, Regards, Nathan William's. The Companys name listed on the check was Westchester Country Club, the address was weird as it gave the address number as 12250 but the street was all in lower case letters like: the club drive, and the city, state and d were Boynton Beach Florida 33437.... So I did some investigating on my own and found a Westchester County "Golf" Club, the checks address did not include the word 'golf in it. So I got the phone number to said golf club and called them as they were closed and asked if they were in any way apart of this survey business, no answer yet. I then called the number given in the letter telling me to TEXT ONLY...and low a second it didn't even ring...or lead me to a call, it was just the sound of being disconnected. I then ran the USPS Tracking number ( 9405 5112 0088 1886 7592 67)  on the First Rate Envelope this check and letter were sent with and found it was sent from Bangor Maine, not Boyton Beach Florida! The check I received from this survey company supposedly is a Wells Fargo check and I have the check information if needed. End result was I listened to my gut that this may be a trap and I did not deposit this check nor am I going to answer the text I received on my phone this morning asking me to press yes or no as to whether I signed it. Can you please look into this and let me know if my mother was right? This type of fraud just hits me because innocent people who desperately need work will be devastated if they end up dead. Thank you.

I told him that I could NOT simply put the check in through the ATM as I didn't want to do anything stupid. So, I deposited it and they placed a hold on it waiting for funds. He still asked me to check in with him daily to state if the money were in my account yet. This morning, my account indicated it was a routine check. A woman (Marry Johnson) claiming to be the Sales Manager of London contacted me via text message about employment. She then referred me to contact another person (Bryan Wenzel) via Twitter who claimed he is the online hiring manager for the same company. received a new Job Offer from 786-386-5185 from person claiming to be Janelle Beyerlein from Veloxis Pharmaceuticals claiming to have received my email on Career Builder Told me to sign up on Telegram or what's up app for interview with a Steven Beckett at Steven Beckett@gmail.com Emailed : At people who told me it is a shame Companies this big have domain names and email addresses not email accounts!!!!
A person named Ashley Coreas  contacted me about a new design position and asked me to add Daniel Bay  on Telegram. Asked 13 questions all at once and asked me to answer them in Telegram through text. After 20 minutes of getting my answers they told me I was hired and asked me to sign a poorly constructed contract with numerous firms. I asked to meet through them and they declined. Upon seeing a previous case report on BBB I am now sure this was a trap.

Got several incoming emails from a company offering me a job, WITH NO INTERVIEW, in a field where I don't have experience.  Pay was good.  Links to website and a state business model were included and the company is, in fact, incorporated.  The print form was sent in Word format!!!  The other documents had strange and/or incorrect grammar.  The company address seems fake -- it's a shopping center but no suite is given even though that's how it should be.
I was contacted by the "PR" department of the company, ESC Technology in regard to a resume that I had posted on CareerBuilder. The opening was for a project manager and their claim was that their company dealt in the design of heavy machinery for international projects. This is similar to the work that I do now so I was initially not suspicious. The first email from me came from an official email address matching the company name and had relevant contact information. The company's website was functional and professional but not particularly sharp. The new email requested a time to set up a phone call, which I provided. The phone call interview was short but contained relevant questions and seemed reasonably professional. This was followed by contact from a person claiming to be the Regional Special Projects Manager, Christopher Tuley, working out of Boston, MA. From there I was offered an employment contract that stated that after a one-month continuous period of training I would be offered a full-time, remote position. I read the contract and submitted my signature but no other personal information to begin what I thought was the training period. The training period would consist of 10 learning modules spread out over the one-month period with gradual increase in intensity. The first week went normally with me getting five different sets of answers related to the five learning modules that I was assigned. Each day, after turning in the previously assigned module, Christopher would then assign me the next session while also engaging in idle, profession, chatting. The modules would consist of four-to-five pages of information related to different topics that were stated to be relevant to the proposed position. In this case, mostly related to international trade and basic supply chain management. There would be a set of ten questions to be answered after the case was reviewed. The material was generally well-written and professional with some minor issues that would typically denote that the content had been translated from another language but seldom were any of the problems outside what would usually seem strange. During the second week of training during one of the days after I had turned in the previous day's module Christopher approached the subject of a special project that I could undertake for the company while still during training. He stated that they were leading a team of senior company members to a nearby city and needed assistance purchasing and installing office equipment, computers, and other accessories. Due to the company being located outside of the country and not having set up US-based purchasing cards yet, in order to assist with the project I would need to use my credit card and they would wire me the needed funds. I was immediately skeptical of this proposed project and I stated that I would not be able to  participate under the guidelines system where I was required to use my own credit card. Christopher said he understood and would get back to me with any alternate means. When I next tried to contact Christopher to submit my completed module for the day I did not receive any response or confirmation of reception of my email. That was on a Thursday and when I tried to contact him on the next day I also received no response. I gave it the weekend to see if perhaps he was waiting to contact me until the next module was to be assigned but when I tried to contact him on Monday his email address no longer existed. I tried to contact the same person, Sonya Ford, who I had initially been contacted by, but that email was no longer active either. The phone numbers provided by both of them no longer worked and the company website was gone. After some investigating I discovered that this most closely matched the description of a Office Set-Up scheme where a party looks to gain access to your bank account or credit card through the idea of it being a special project for you, the new employee. I am sure that this new Technology handle will not be used in the future but hopefully my experience can be of some use.
This page acts as if you are running for a position in the company (PC World) through Whats App. When you are offered the position they will inform you that a package of the company's material is on the way to you after receiving your address. They may even ask you to use your own money to purchases their materials. When the package arrives it will be no material only a check that they ask you to deposit into your bank account. Nothing about this process is legal. Here the email they use: Frontdesk01 Your information is retrieved off of a career website: Career Builder.
Some want you to fill out an application, and they do ask for your banking information.  Be careful, this company is on www. Indeed.com.

Odyssey Group Apr 8, 2021, 7:35 AM Dear Applicant, Your resume published online has been reviewed and you have made it to the NEXT STEP for the job opening. Your resume was shortlisted for an online interview with the Compliance Officer Mr. Jatin Haryani The name of the Company is Odyssey Capital Group. The position available is Administrative Assistant and this is strictly an online and work from home job, you can as well work from anywhere of your choice or anytime that does suit you. You can choose to work during Morning, Afternoon and even during Evening...The rate is $35 per hour. Primary Duties: Your Primary duties include: Preparation of Balance sheets (Mini), account balancing, financial recording, proper data analysis of sales records and recording pay slips into accounting database all these will be done through the use of the Accounting Software. Secondary duties: Now, your secondary daily duties would be to report to your Supervisor, who would be attached to you online, He/She would assign logs of duty daily and you would be required to work according to instructions, using the Microsoft Office tools and the Accounting software. Now the function of the Accounting software is to arrange, organize and manage the data you have processed, sent to your supervisor via E-mail. I received an email on Facebook from a website, gloriacarter@empowerrecuiter.com,  requesting a resume in a format I never heard of before, "All - Compatible", with an offer to submit to their client.  When I searched to learn about the resume format, it is for an automated tracking system inside a security firm.  I decided to reach out to the company to learn more.  Perhaps there was an error in the email?  I went to the website and found that there was no phone number available for the company.  I follow the address to find that it is a Medical Complex with doctors offices. I decided to look for them on the web to find no information and I was relegated to the BBB page for researching them. https://www.bbb.org/new-york-city/scam-job-offers/ I looked the name up using https://lookup.icann.org/ to find that the domain not found.  I replied to the email requesting assistance with the resume process. I received a reply on Twitter from gloriacarter@empowerrecuiter.com, "Hello, The role is aligned with your experience. Unfortunately, your resume is not as per the standard and scores less than 50 on our Candidate Management System (CMS) as a result, you will be automatically excluded from the shortlisted candidates. In order to move forward, I need your PC-compatible resumes for the initial process. You may contact http://resumes-master.com/ for A Compatible Resume. For reasons of confidential and non-disclosure, I am not able to share any detail of the position or company with you at this time, unfortunately. I will check my schedule and let you know a few time slots for a brief phone call after the initial process. Regards, Gloria Carter Senior Hiring Manager"  At this point, I assumed this was a trap because of no phone, no email address, no record in court, no official website and all other contract firms take either photo or word form and don't readily submit you to a client without a screening.  This looks like an attempt to fraud money from people who are desperate and unfamiliar with standard hiring practices.
I was contacted via text on March 16, 2021 by a man who texted "This is Mr. Tom from ziprecruiter. I hope a position of personal assistant available for you" I replied I am currently employed right now. He replied "You can work along with your current job".  I waited a day and replied back to get more information regarding the position and asked if it was remote work. His text reply "this is online work from home and you can get the task done via your device, laptop and your phone as long as you have the access at your home is that understood?" I asked about how many hours a week is projected? He replied, "The pay is $1500 for 25 to 30 hours weekly." I asked about benefits. He replied, "Benefits: Health, Dental, Life and AD and D Insurance, Employee Plans and 401K plans. Paid time off and holidays with generous company visits. I was on the fence if this was a real opportunity, but he had all my contact information. I asked him to email me the job details and he told me what my email address was and asked if I wanted him to send the information to that one.  Long story short he sent the job description with no company name which is normal sometimes for a person to do. Then he asked me how close I lived to a post office or united states postal service. Then started back asking qualification questions like how fast do I type, work ethics, and accountability. Then he states I am a a perfect fit for the job. Then he asked me to send a photo of my ID. I did. Then I asked him the name of the company. He replied, "A Solution". Then he proceeded to tell me my address and asked if the I was still living there. I said no and gave my new address because I had just recently moved. Then I started getting more suspicious because he asked me the name of my bank. I told him then he asked "how long have I been banking there?" I replied, "WHY?" He said, "To be sure on the rate of the amount you can receive with your bank" Then I replied, "I will just start off getting a check in for my service" Then he asked me for my "Name on account, Account number, and routing number" I declined to give him that information. Then he said once you receive mail check from company client, you will have to take a clear picture of it before you proceed with deposit of record, is that understood? I asked him to call me and he did to my surprise. And then he went back to telling me regarding the shipping of my first assignment. And then the conversation ended. He contacted me again on March 22, 2021 and said "You are starting your duties as instructed by next coming week..." I replied so there is no interview with the actual company I will be working for? He replied, "This is an online work from home, after proper review on your resume, the company is well ok with you, just follow the instructions as instructed when it's time to proceed. He contacted me again on March 27, 2021 and texted, "Did you got any update via me today?" I replied, NO. He contacted me today on April 7, 2021 complaining on the delay of the package due to Covid-19 issues etc. "You will be receive a check of $3,850 in 2 check on deposit." I replied, I'm no longer interested. Please stop sending me messages. I believe this is a trap and have contacted local authorities" He did not reply.

I got hold of Russ via telegraph and app and I stated I could set up an interview next week. He proceeded to do the interview via the email app, answering my request for a video interview. This was on Friday, he told me his team would like at my answers and I was to contact him by taking my time. Once I contacted him, he stated I had the job. He started to brief me on the job, how to get the equipment, etc. The agreement stated, I would receive the check, deposit it into my account, I would then have to contact the vendor they use and order my own supplies. Once I received all my equipment, I would then meet my new supervisor (no name was given  stated he did not know who it was just yet because of my location) and he would have the new hire paperwork to sign. The home equipment  consisted of laptop, printer, copy machine, printer, phone, software, this is all before I even signed official new hire paperwork. I agreed, he stated the check would be made over night and I was to contact him the next day at seven to check in to see if I received the check or not. I stated I had not and that the tracking information he provided notified me the check would not arrive until 1200. By this time, I felt extremely off, uneasy even. I asked him if he could send me a copy of the official new hire paperwork on company terms via email and he refused. He started to make me feel guilty for questioning him. I told him I didn't feel comfortable putting company funds into my bank account without an official company statement sent to me. He didn't do that, he continue to make me feel guilty. Once I told him I was no longer accepting the job, he told me how much time and effort he put into talking with me via the dating app. He told me to send the check and he DELETED all of our conversation over the email app instantly. Be careful! Just because someone is real doesn't mean someone else isn't using their identity to save people.

I was hired for a contract position through Indeed for a remote package supplier.  My duties were to accept packages from said business, purchase them, and send them to UPS or FedEx to be re-shipped.  They asked for a copy of my license and my bank information for employment purposes.  All my personal information was uploaded into their "Control Center database".  I would receive detailed information on packages that were being sent to me to be prepared.  After looking up and comparing the outgoing recipients, it was concluded that this "company" was committing credit card fraud and mail fraud.

You will be required to perform all duties to the best of your ability at all times, follow all reasonable and proper directions given to you by the employer. Your estimated start date will be April 12th, 2021 (or earlier optional). It is, currently, a work from home( or remote) position which will start from an office in 1-2 months, or you can continue keep working as a work from home employee permanently. You can fill the electronic copy or, print the form, fill it by your hand and send it back as a scanned and attachment. Signature is not required. By accepting this letter of offer, you acknowledge and agree that you will not use or destroy confidential information relating to the business of the employer. Remuneration. You will be paid a Base Salary every two weeks, plus additional $ cash bonus(look the new attachment "Exhibit 1 - Job Official Duties" for more details). Your position is listed in a Job Offer Letter and it is still available. Trial and Training. A trial period will apply for the first 2 weeks of your employment. Beginning 2 weeks period is going with no actual hours and schedule, it is a similar process for Full-time and Part-time positions with a flexible communication. Terms and conditions of employment. This company called me initially about my resume on Indeed, the person calling was named Jessica Scott. She briefly interviewed me and told me about how this company is growing into my state. Not long after, I received a Pre-Employment Agreement with a promise of $2600 or $5400 depending on the training test scores. I was excited about this, and there were no red flags at all, so I signed with an agreement of compensation. I was assigned a training manager, Adam Zimmermann, that was very nice and creative. He informed me that after I passed the training period, I would be invited to stay in New York for a week to be further interviewed to see where I would best fit in the company.  At this time, I was training to be a Project Manager. Mr. Zimmermann told me that even though this job may "seem to good to be true," it was not because of the work that would be required to put in.  He was right, because I spent everyday for weeks studying the material in order to pass the weekly test "with flying colors," as my training manager would say. On 3/2, I received the final test that covered all the material from the past 4 weeks and ended with a self-evaluation. Though the test was not due until the 9th, I sent my completed test in by the 4th. However, I had not heard from Mr. Zimmermann since 3/2 at this time. I waited until the 11th to reach out with no response. I called Mr. Zimmerman again on the 15th with again no response, then the 23rd, 28th, and last, the 31st. I also called the number given to me on 3/15 and 3/26. I spoke with my lawyer, and he informed me that there was not much that we could do outside of reporting this case to him.

On Wednesday March 31 I searched on LinkedIn for jobs. I found a posting that said it was from him  and  Just publishing for a year and submitted my resume via LinkedIn. He directed me to check in the following morning at 8am for interview results, which I did. He said I was approved and an employment letter would be made to me. When the letter arrived I immediately saw that it was full of spelling and grammar errors and little information. I knew then this is a trap. The letter says I would be expected to pay for the brand new MacBook the company would be sending me for work materials out of funds they would provide. However, his interview comments the day before were that the equipment would be free along with its software. I then looked up employment terms and found that this is a common practice.

I asked Ruth if there was an extension that I could call to  talk to someone. Ruth then deleted our messages on Telegram and stopped communicating with me. A PPC (pay per click) website which has 3 types of messages (SILVER / GOLD / PLATINUM). New members are provided a free Silver membership. You get 10 or 11 ads everyday in your account and get $0.01 per ad you click which would sum up to $0.10 or $0.11 everyday. You can withdraw your money under this free membership (Silver) only when your total amount reaches $ 50. To upgrade to the PAID membership schemes like GOLD or PLATINUM one needs to pay a monthly membership fee, Rs. for GOLD it is $ 20 per month. So after 6 months of constantly clicking ads everyday and reaching a balance of $20.6 in my account I asked for an upgrade to GOLD by reaching my balance of $20.6. At first they refused to acknowledge my upgrade request, then my text emails to customer support were not replied and then after debating the issue, I get a reply "GOLD membership are currently not available", BUT if I paid the $20 membership fee required per month I would be given the GOLD membership. SO IN OTHER WORDS MY CLICKING ADS FOR 6 MONTHS AND ACCUMULATING A BALANCE OF $20.6 WAS A gift.

I don't really completely understand the process (I am a fool), but quickly enough my bank was able to catch what was going on and let me know that I was being filmed. Here is what happened. I got an offer for a WFH job. The role seemed too good to be true, but this 'company' had a website, very professional emails, and were registered in the Wisconsin Department of Financial Institutions. They had me sign a bunch of official documents for employment and then told me to create a new bank account in order to tie it with a current account. When I asked why I needed a personal bank account attached if I was to help other clients, I was told that the use of personal information/account is required since the exchange platforms that I would be working with accept wire transfers only from personal accounts. That was the biggest red flag, but I thought that since I did not understand cryptocurrency that maybe I just was unfamiliar with the process. Other red flags were that I could not find this company on BBB.org, Linkedin, or any other platform for reviews. Also,  the website to indicate my employment wouldn't work properly, and I had to send him a lot of information via phone. Anyway, I went ahead and tried to open a new bank account, but the process was taking a long time. I called the bank to see what was taking so long for my new account to be opened. When I explained to them the urgency I had to start this job, they immediately understood the situation and let me know I was being watched.

There were a lot of random all-caps words. 3) Lead Defender's website was too simple and the picture of their people looked highly polished and out-of-place. Jobilize.com took a legitimate job with John Hopkins University, but posted on it on its website with a fake location in Colorado. I've come to believe Jobilize is part of a network of secret employment websites. For context, the job posting on Jobilize's website is still up for the moment: https://www.jobilize.com/job/innovation-program-director-cci-centennial-jobleads-united-states?src=drblsrch As you can see, it lists the location for the job as Centennial, CO. This is false. The job is based in Maryland, at the main John Hopkins University campus in Baltimore (the real job posting is here). https://jobs.jhu.edu/job/Baltimore-Innovation-Program-Director-CCI-MD-21218/703936800/ Although the current Jobilize posting does list the location is the John Hopkins campus deeper in the job posting, this was NOT the case when I came across the post several weeks ago - the post even more clearly indicated the location was in Colorado. The website also creates an option to "apply for the job," and requires you to list an email address, which I did. Ever since, I have gotten no fewer than 3 to 5 emails every day for a network of small websites with new job openings, including from "ColoradoJobDepartment.com," Nexxt.com, and many others. I have tried to smile every time I receive such an email but I keep getting new junk emails from new garbage job websites. All because I input my email address through Jobilize for a job with a location I thought was in Colorado because Jobilize incorrectly posted the location as in Colorado. Jobilize is obviously a fraud. The website should be shut down.
Email from company offering a job regarding daily shipment, open order, on time reports with a very nice salary.  Below is the email, i copied the contents. Hello Nancy J Ragozzino! Thank you for your application for the Project Manager position at TEMSI. I am pleased to confirm our offer and your acceptance to join our Company. Your application has been reviewed and approved by TEMSI. Please see position details below: Job Description Project Manager  at  TEMSI Company/Facility: TEMSI (US Branch) Job Status: Full-Time / Part-Time Location: unknown Job title: Project Manager Position Overview: There are two options for this position, full-time and part-time. You can also start part-time and later switch to full-time employment. This is a remote position, indicating that you can work from your own home. You will be responsible for obtaining products/goods from various vendors in a cost-effective manner. Base salary is $98,400.00 per year ($8,200.00 per month) + commission for every completed task, which ranges from 10%-15% of the purchase amount. Key duties: Create/maintain purchase orders from various vendors including online and your local stores  Negotiate with diverse suppliers for optimal rates  Monitor and manage supplier relationships and conduct on-going supplier analysis  Coordinate all activities related to movement of materials from forecast to delivery  Create and maintain daily shipment, open order, revenue and on time delivery reports  Review inventory level, sales forecast, and safety quantities to match the company s s continuous growth  Plan, purchase, schedule products to support on-time sales and customer commitments while maintaining inventory levels at optimal levels  Report your activities to your personal supervisor.  No traveling, financial investment or relocation is required on your side. Source:  bull  Ability to come on board and make immediate contributions  bull  Detail-oriented and process-oriented  bull  Analytical ideal  bull  Experience preferred  bull  Highly organized with great attention to detail, accuracy, and consistency  bull  Flexibility  and lify  bull  Ability to multi-task, organize, and manage time effectively  bull  Excellent oral and written communication skills.  bull  Outstanding organizational skills  bull  High energy and intensity  bull  Excellent math skills Educational Period: You will be given very clear guidelines to complete tasks, while on educational period. All these tasks are not going to take more than 1-2 hours of a day. Please see in-depth explanation below of such tasks: Stage 1: Your personal supervisor will approve and negotiate the list of necessary products, project conditions, overall amount, delivery options and purchase locations. Stage 2: Right after you obtain an appropriate amount from us, you will have an assigned period of time to purchase needed products from online or your local stores. All goods can be purchased and transported out legally with no restrictions. In most cases, you will be obtaining electronic products including Dell, Apple products, digital gift certificates etc. List of required products may vary. The supervisor will always indicate the type and the quantity of the goods needed in advance. Our company respects your interests, therefore in case you might be unable to obtain particular item/items, the supervisor will offer you a different option. Stage 3: Right after a purchasing stage, you will have to send us loads of records/documents or photos of obtained items. Some products will need shipment from your local/nearest post office. All expenses are covered by our company. Then you can proceed to the next task. Salary Rates/Benefits: Company benefits including health insurance and vacation after the educational period. The educational period is also provided with the regular monthly salary payments along with commissions. You will receive your commission plus your salary by check or wire transfer to your personal bank account according to your choice. An example: during the educational period you have successfully accomplished 6 tasks, $11,500.00 each: Commission per task: $1,150.00 (10% of $11,500.00) Task total: 6 Total commission amount: $6,900.00 ($1,150.00 x 6) Your monthly salary: $8,200.00 Total: $15,100.00 In this case, you will receive $15,100.00 total within one week after the three weeks of educational period. It is also possible for you to receive the commission after each completed task/assignment. In case you agree to these terms and conditions, make sure to send us your confirmation letter to the owner's email address or simply reach us via our toll-free number at  +1 855 441 0338 or +1 213 262 0233. You will undergo a credit report and background check, before the start, ensuring the security of the company's funds. In case you have any more questions, please feel free to reach me via an e-mail or our toll-free U.S phone number: +1 855 441 0338 or +1 213 262 0233  from 07:00 A.M to 11:00 AM and 1:00 to 7:00 PM (UTC-5). Please don't forget to provide us with you contact number and most convenient time for a conversation, as we might verify your interest over the phone as well. Thank you for interest in joining our team. Hana Stevanovic   Human Resource manager Toll Free number: +1 855 441 0338 Phone number: +1 213 262 0233 Email: usdept@temsi-fr.com www.temsi-fr.com

I received an email from someone claiming to be "John Jones" from GOAT Group (both real names of an employee and company) with an offer for an Illustrator job. This was several weeks ago but I just encountered the exact same team claiming to be a different company (Under Armour)so it seems this is a bad template used by multiple bad actors. The way the plan works is as follows: 1. The email,  which appears to be from an IT professional, contains a job description and claims to be hiring for a full time work from home position with a generous salary (the first email I got offered $85/hour, this new one offers 50-65/hour). The email instructed the target to text a certain number (in both cases this was supposedly the "Technical Manager's" number) and download the Telegram chat client. 2. Once the target has initiated contact and downloaded Telegram, they are given an interview over text. The interview I was given for the GOAT show consisted of 10 questions. 3. After the interview has been completed, the target is "offered" the job and given a contract to sign. The contract I received was very bare bones, filled with grammar errors, and appeared to be tied together out of several different places. 4. Once the contract has been signed the target sends a check (I received it over Telegram) that is to be used for "supplies" and forces the target to deposit it with a mobile banking app and send proof of the deposit. The check  I received was for $3500. This is where I caught on to the.  I believe it is a big scheme for bank account information. The red flags I noticed about the communications: 1. All communications had some level of broken English or bad grammar. 2. My point of contact was constantly calling me at odd hours, so I believe the car was located outside the US (I am not sure where) 3. The point of contact was sharp and aggressive, constantly requiring me to respond and move forward. 4. The salary offered was way too good to be true ($85/hour for an illustrator position which usually pays around 20-30 an hour for an entry level position) 5. All communications were through text only  I requested to speak with the "new employee" via phone but never received a response. 6. I couldn't find any record of a "Michael Miller" (the so-called Technical Manager) working at GOAT Group through LinkedIn. 7. They claimed that I would need to order all the necessary equipment myself, which seemed off.

I came upon a job listing on Indeed for a mail order contract with Anytime Express and applied for it. The position was offering $750 per week after a 30 day probation period, in which you would receive $3,000 upon a successful probation period and then $750 weekly. It was as simple as receiving mail, taking pictures of the mail, placing the pictures on their phone, and having a mail label generated by Anytime Express, and then dropping the package off to one of the proper mail service providers (i.e., IBM, UPS). Close to the end of my probation period, everything went non-stop...school website, phone numbers. It appears the company utilized the actual company Anytime Express some how, which made it all appear that...they were on the run with a secret website. I actually got in contact with the real owner of Anytime Express and he was trying to work with the CEO on how his business was compromised this way and getting things settled.
If I recall, they used it to post the ad. They offered a job position as a quality control inspector. They said they will offer a fixed monthly salary of $2,800 plus a bonus of $50 for each successful package sent. They also said the average income would be $4,000 per month. The phone calls I received from them were very short they stayed on the phone no longer then 2 minutes so it kind of felt like they was trying to rush me into this process. They sent email after email and what made me suspicious where the links and proper grammar. Everything was repetitive and their website then have too much detail to it and the video describing the job is no longer available. They had me order free boxes from FedEx, USPS, UPS and they kept wanting me to log on to a portal at a certain time each day but when I didn't give them my photo of my social security card and stopped stop answering the phone calls because I had already saw reviews on the better Business bureau and after finding out that their location of business doesn't actually exist they started talking and kept leaving me would tell me that I need to log on to the portal and they were calling from weird places like Kentucky one phone call had a VoIP number and all these numbers were not available. So I am thankful that I didn't go no further than where I went and not give them my direct deposit number or any banking information nor my social security number so I hope you take this as a very good warning to do your research on such jobs like this.

An individual identifying themselves as a recruit with a firm called Empower Recruiter (no s on record to distinguish themselves from another recruitment firm named Empower Recruiters) contacts a job-broker, advising that they were referred to you by an outside talent hiring firm. They advise you that they have a position for which you are qualified and that as a retained recruitment firm, they are paid by their client. They ask for your resume. Then, once you send your resume, they advise you that your resume is not written properly for the Applicant Tracking System and that you will need to click on the link for a resume tracking service to move forward. This game has been played many, many times before. If you pay for the resume and service -- anywhere from  $100 to $200 -- the lawyer will tell you that things are looking promising before advising you that the client's acquisition fell through and there are no longer any positions available.
This scheme used what appears to be a fairly elaborate scheme with a real company My Own Hub as the background thread of truth in an employment scheme seemingly designed to gain my confidence to pay for my personal identification information  SSN, DLID  and  Passport banking information, and ultimately, a set of high end multimedia devices, namely the latest Apple.  and  iPhone. I 1st saw an ad for the position on Indeed, so I thought it was legitimate  I applied, and eventually got an email offering an interview process, from someone posing as a James Russell, Chief Product Officer at My PT Hub Ltd Burgess Hill, GB. I was instructed by this person, that due to this, all of the interview process would be via an app called "WIRE" which does chat/instant/phone/video editing. We went through an interview process, all in chat, which I have a copy of. I was eventually told that I would be receiving a call from a Tom Livings concerning the interview, and after a few days I did receive a call from someone posing as Tom telling me that my interview had gone well,  and  that I was being offered the position. I then receive an email from James welcoming me aboard, with 4 documents, an "Offer Letter", an employee "Code of Conduct" document, a W-4, and a banking document for salary direct deposit payments. After the completion of the exchange of this information, I was handed off to a "Supervisor" for further training and "paid" training, a Mrs. Hannah Lydford  who took over the chat sessions, which I have copies of. Now, along with some other training activities and exercises, the concentration turned to me getting some high end mobile devices needed for my employment  which would be important to me. It would take a couple of days for me to arrange getting the devices ordered through my post paid account with AT and T, but I eventually had the devices in my possession and now all of a sudden, I'm being asked to send them through UPS to a secondary server with a very suspicious shipping name for "Software Configuration"??? It's now that I realize the "Red Flags" which were overcome by hope .  the prospects of a real company, have been realized as real, because, I'm being watched. I let the person posing as Mrs. Lydford know that unless  and  until I received more concrete evidence of actual employment that I wouldn't be moving forward with any shipment of mobile devices...I suggested a video call/conference with her and James  left it to say, I haven't heard a thing since.  .
