On September 3rd 2020 I received an email from Amanda Hunter (amanda.hunter@corecapitalassets.com), Human Resources Manager at Novenburg Estates, saying that they have an offer of employment for the vacancy of Assistant Manager. After responding to Amanda's email showing my interest, she sent me more details about the position (please refer to the attached file position here). The offer was a home based position and she said as soon as they look through the online application, one of their Human Resource managers will call me within 2 business days to conduct a brief interview. I submitted my application following the application link provided in the file and 2 days later September 5th 2020 a representative, a man with an Indian accent called me for a brief interview with basic questions. The next day on November 6th 2020, Amanda sent me another email with an attached file containing the link to invite me to create an account in their back office system (https://backoffice.corecapitalassets.com/signup). She asked me, once I would have finished the creation of my back-office account to contact Kate Higgins using my personal message board. Kate Higgins (kate.higgins@corecapitalassets.com) was my personal manager. I was in contact with Kate using emails in the back office system for training, instructions, tasks and guidance. I spoke over the phone with Brian Fuller (phone number 215-845-9455) 3 times, for procedures and tasks and requests. Brian was the Office Manager and indeed the only person I could talk to. I was required as full time employee to do 4 business weeks  + 2-4 days for final determination. I have never received a final contract. During my training, I was asked to open a bank account for work and training purpose in order to withdraw in cash the money I will receive to purchase Bitcoin at specific ATM machine in my area, for clients investments, and send the cash to specific clients. I have done 3 small transactions of this purchase with the money 3 people sent to my bank account using the service Zelle. The people are Nelson Petcher(sent $100), and Rose de Prosperi(sent $75), the third transaction was a wire transfer from Bank Of America industrial LLC(sent $455). I purchased in total Bitcoin worth $300 via 2 different online websites and 1 Bitcoin ATM. After working my schedule from 9am to 5pm every day since November 9th, I have never received my salary, beside $200 as first part of my salary paid on December 3rd 2020 via transfer on my work bank account and $130 I received as bonus for the tasks I have done. To date, I worked over two months for Novenburg Estates, and have not received payment for hours worked to date!! On December 9th 2020, Kate Sent me an email offering me a new opportunity. The opportunity was to become a Business Account Owner, in order to deal with corporate clients and larger investments amount from $30,000 to $90,000. Becoming Business Account Owner I would receive increase of salary rate From $27/her to $35/hour and bigger bonus. Kate needed me to confirm my interest in the opportunity by confirming my personal information such as first and last name, correct email address and my SSN. She told me they needed my personal data for application filling and LLC registration. Business Account Manager was an extension/upgrade of my existing position of Assistant Manager. I declined the new offer and asked to work normally, the time to master all the parts of my work as Assistant Manager. So I continued to work normally and on December 11th 2020, Kate told me to monitor my bank account for possible funds allocation. I didn't receive any funds until December 14th 2020 she asked me again to monitor my bank account for 2 mini deposits from clients in order to verify my account in the system for future transactions. The same day on December 14th 2020 Brian called me to require that I answer to Kate, and I told him I already did letting her know that I didn't receive any money. So Brian asked me to send Kate a photo of my bank account, what I did. I continued to monitor my bank account every day, the transactions never showed up, until December 22nd when my online account access stopped working. I called my bank Wells Fargo on December 23rd and I have been told my bank account was blocked for fraud suspicion. And I had to make an appointment and visit a branch to check my account, what I did on December 30th 2020. I the meantime I sent numerous email to Kate via the system from December 21st 2020 to January 12th 2021 to inform about my salary, my employment status, my account blocked by the bank, information about the origin the amount and the purpose of the wire transfer I received... Kate never answered to all of my concerns. After a Google image search of Kate Higgins picture from her back office profile, it appeared that the picture corresponds to a different name Holly Hirshfield. I came to the conclusion that I have been raped and immediately reported my experience to the police who offered me a case number. This apparent change is unusual as no money exchanged hands...YET.  It began with them offering small amounts of money to invest and then I became suspicious after increased requests for more personal information that made me more vulnerable to being questioned.
The woman who called was hard to understand.  She sent me emails stating there was employment for me. Asking me to supply my license info and copies.  I sent basic info and realized she was a lot older. So i replied not interested.
This is a social marketing agency with no experience or credentials forcing young people to sign up for 100% commission roles and asking businesses to pay for their services. They offer a dual cell type structure for employee retention. They invited my to an interview that I never applied for. Many similar in Miami (Baires, Lima, ABC, etc)

After several emails back and forth received info about the headquarters office in SC but that they would be opening an office in my city in mid February 2021. They promised a laptop and printer for use for the position. Still no request for money. After continued relentless emails that they really needed someone in my area I began to further research the company and on doing nothing with their name shows. Additionally I also noticed that on the BBB listing for their name they are not accredited and a file had been opened just a week prior. Hi, Please make time to read all important notes as this is your guide on how to do your tasks. KINDLY READ: Important Notes   Attached here is the Manual.  Kindly download the document. It will illustrate you every step you need to take to process packages properly. Please find time to review it.   Changing of Address is prohibited for the first 30 days to confirm security of packages. You can request changing of address when you are no longer in Question Period.   For future reference, this is how we deal with packages missing: 1. double check this pack with your family members, they might have received the pack 2. double check this pack around your house ( porch, outside the door, trash bin outside, all) 3. double check this pack with your nearest neighbors. It happens sometimes that the delivery man brought the pack in your neighbor's house. This happened before on one of our employees. If there is a need to mention the name of the customer of the pack, please do so. 4. if still not found, call carrier and report a claim on the missing pack so an investigation will be initiated.   PLEASE don't open the Manufacturer's box or Device box. You are allowed though to open just the brown carrier's box.    Steps on how to place pictures correctly in your Dashboard: 1. Make sure " Task Accepted" and " Received" is clicked. 2. Click " Photo" to a picture of the product. Click " Packing List" to read more. 3. Go to Select Files. 4. Select the picture and click Open. 5. Wait till the loading bar turns  100%. 6. Read the page and double check if the photo is still there. Note: If you're getting an error or if your photo doesn't show in your database, edit your photo so that picture size will be smaller. If possible, use mobile phone to take pictures as they come in small size. Read the page then and reload the photo.   Remove Invoice or Packing list from the package after taking pictures to avoid double taxation.   If you receive a package not showing in the store, please report it as an Unknown Package. Refer to the following steps: 1) Go to Packages. 2) Click on REPORT UNKNOWN PACKAGE button 3) Enter all the information of the package. 4) Click Save.   If you will be on leave, kindly follow 1 week notice. Provide us ahead your scheduled leave for approval.   For resignation cases, please contact us in advance so we can process your clearance from the company and so we can stop sending packages to be inspected. Please let me know if you have any concerns.? Thank you and have a good day!? --- Kind regards, Perla Wilcox Supervisor   Shipping Department Direct number: (313)2175244,R 15135 Hamilton Ave, Block C-12, Highland Park, MI 48203 (888) 509-9271 Mon-Sun 09:00AM-06:00PM EST Sat-Sun Closed
Hi, Please make time to read all important notes as this is your guide on how to do your tasks. KINDLY READ: Important Notes   Attached here is the Manual.  Kindly download the document. It will illustrate you every step you need to take to process packages properly. Please find time to review it.   Changing of Address is prohibited for the first 30 days to confirm security of packages. You can request changing of address when you are no longer in Question Period.   For future reference, this is how we deal with packages missing: 1. double check this pack with your family members, they might have received the pack 2. double check this pack around your house ( porch, outside the door, trash bin outside, all) 3. double check this pack with your nearest neighbors. It happens sometimes that the delivery man brought the pack in your neighbor's house. This happened before on one of our employees. If there is a need to mention the name of the customer of the pack, please do so. 4. if still not found, call carrier and report a claim on the missing pack so an investigation will be initiated.   PLEASE don't open the Manufacturer's box or Device box. You are allowed though to open just the brown carrier's box.    Steps on how to place pictures correctly in your Dashboard: 1. Make sure " Task Accepted" and " Received" is clicked. 2. Click " Photo" to a picture of the product. Click " Packing List" to read more. 3. Go to Select Files. 4. Select the picture and click Open. 5. Wait till the loading bar turns  100%. 6. Read the page and double check if the photo is still there. Note: If you're getting an error or if your photo doesn't show in your database, edit your photo so that picture size will be smaller. If possible, use mobile phone to take pictures as they come in small size. Read the page then and reload the photo.   Remove Invoice or Packing list from the package after taking pictures to avoid double taxation.   If you receive a package not showing in the store, please report it as an Unknown Package. Then, i received an email from someone named Eleanor Cabrera that described a position for a "quality control associate" at eHub Inspect, which involved receiving packages at my house, sending them, and then shipping them back off. I went through the process and applied and was offered a position. I then had to make an account where i entered some personal information like my address, bank information, and a picture of my drivers license. Through this account i would see what packages i would be receiving, input data, see how much i'm earning, message the "supervisor", and so on. I was told that the first month would be a transitional period where i would receive a less than average number of packages and would not be paid until the month is over. Throughout this month, I would often message the supervisor and ask questions as a new employee would, and I found that the responses were very vague and rarely ever answered my questions. If i sent a message, i would not receive a response for a day or two which i thought to be odd for a company that claimed communication was key between supervisor and employee. My first payment date (the date I was supposed to receive my earnings, which had accumulated to a lot at this point) was scheduled exactly a month after the first day i started sending out packages, which would complete my payment period. As this date approached, I would message the supervisor and would get no response. The date passed and still no response. I tried to contact any email or phone number on their website, which looks very real and credible, and they are all fake. Nothing on the website works. I have tried calling Eleanor Cabrera and the email comes back. All the email addresses on their website bounce back. The phone number does not even ring. I have tried logging back into my account and it wonn't let me. I cannot gain access to anything in the account. However, I kept a record of all the messages between me and the "supervisor". This company and whoever is behind it is a complete stranger. I am sure they have done this to many people and who knows what else is going on behind the scenes.

On the night of July 6th I received a text message from this phone number 1-7687 introducing herself as Jasmine Grenier a Temporary Secretary at Grupo Santillana Company, telling me that they were interested in meeting me. She then provided me with the instruction to download an app called Telegram Messenger and to message someone by the name of Gabriel Joaquin on the search app at (702) 814-3096 to begin the interview process. I followed the instructions and was interviewed through the video app that night. They asked about my qualifications per my resume, normal interview questions and the only personal information they asked about was my full name, address, cell number, and email. The next morning I was instructed by Gabriel Joaquin to report at 8am via the app and he would tell me if I was selected.    I followed the instruction so on January 7th, 2021 I contacted Gabriel Joaquin at 8am and he informed me I got the job and would be receiving an employment offer letter the next day. I received the letter on January 8, 2021 via email, but had questions about the missing details so I spoke with Gabriel Joaquin on the Facebook app that day to go through my doubts. I was told that a physical copy would be sent to me but that has not come in as of 14-20. Due to some difficulties with what was explained to me on the Facebook app and the offer letter, I asked for some permission and they updated it and sent it back to me that afternoon (08-01) and I reluctantly signed it and sent it back via email. The same day Gabriel Joaquin explained that "we have several firms, associated and educational institutions that we work for and they will be responsible for providing the funds needed for the purchasing of the materials" by material he meant work materials. He went on to explain that I would receive the checks, deposit them and make payments to vendors for my work materials.    He then told me that Wellsfargo allows mobile deposits and asked what my daily deposit limit was, I provided him with the information and he explained that the would be sending me a check and to let him know when it arrived so he could give me the step by step of how to deposit the funds. I received the first check January 11, 2021 via email, let him know on the Facebook app, and he proceeded to explain how to make the mobile deposit. I made the deposit and sent him a screen shot of the confirmation. My banking app told me the check wouldn't be available until the next day so I informed him of that and our conversation ended for that day (11-20).    The next day 12-12 he reached out to ask about the status of the of the check, I checked in my mobile banking app and it clear, I informed him of that and sent a screen shot. That day (12-20) He asked me to send $850.00 to an apple pay account with a phone number (0-8488. I did that sent a screen shot to him for confirmation and then he asked me to send $350 through Zelle to Herbygirl@hotmail.com First name: Jennifer Last name Hackett. I did that sent the confirmation screen shot to him and then the informed me that I would be getting a second check later that day 12-11. I received it and deposited it and let him know it wouldn't be available until the next day 13-12.    Our conversation ended there. On 13-June he reached out asking me if the money was available which at that when I checked it was. But later when I tried to move the money to the vendors via Zelle I was given an error message that the number I was sending the money to could not receive any more money today. So I talk to Gabriel Joaquin on the Facebook app to tell him that, send the screen shot of the error and he said to wait and try again later.    I tried again around 8am and noticed the check for $1,200 I deposited on 12-11 was gone. I told Gabriel Joaquin, and then called Wellsfargo to ask what the problem was, the customer service guy didn't give much details and told me to check tomorrow to see if the check cleared. I informed Gabriel Joaquin and he asked me to cover the $600 from my personal funds and that I could take the $600 back from the next check. I told him no, and he said it was fine to wait until tomorrow. Today 14-June, I woke up to a message from Gabriel Joaquin asking about the status of the check. I checked my mobile banking app and it didn't clear. I also had a message from my bank in my email saying the check didn't clear due to alter/fictitious reasons. I sent that information to Gabriel Joaquin and he said a new check would be sent. I received the check in my email. I had an appointment with my bank at noon to open a new checking account for this new job, and as I explained the details to the banker of why I needed this new account she alerted me that this was probably a fraud, and that my relationship with my bank would be at risk if I continued to deposit checks and distribute the funds. She also informed me that I am responsible for the amounts on the checks in case after 7 days they aren't fully cleared. She asked me to strongly consider not moving forward with this "new job" or money moving because I would be at greater risk of owing Wells Fargo more money. After leaving the bank I started the reporting process on the Better Business Bureau page. I have not lost any money as of 14-20. Attached is the first check I received. I have 2 other checks and the offer letter saved in case they're needed.

I received an email from ginadoanhr@gmail.com telling me I was tapped for a data entry position with Periscope Data Analytics and asking me to do an interview on Google Earth. I had sent my resume to many platforms before so this sounded great. I looked up the name Gina Doan  and  found her on LinkedIn working at Sisense, which is the new company name after Periscope Data Analytics merged with Sisense (the name obviously stole the identity of that person  and  used old company name to sound like). I did the interview in writing  and  was offered a data entry job for USD 35 per hour (.  this rate for this job was the first thing that made me suspicious). I then received an email congratulating me  and  informing me that I will receive a check by mail to buy necessary software for the job  and  office equipment to set up my desk at home. This raised a red flag as I had heard about checkups before, but I decided to go along with it to report the case eventually. I did receive a check for $4,950 issued by Direct Grading  and lify, LLC (it exists online as a road services company in Nevada. Another name steal I guess). The painter's address on the USPS envelope was William Bailey from California (it exists online as the name of a painter who died recently!) The envelope also had a note about a Mountain View Car Special arrangement with instructions. When I asked that person about the letter, they said it was sent by mistake as their agency handles many things. She (or he) told me to send the deposit slip as soon as I deposit the check  and  they will give me instructions to keep a portion as my first payment (!)  and  send the rest to a person who will be my trainer. I asked why didn't the company send the money to the trainer directly? Why trust me? They said "It's because of the trainers, so they will be delivering and installing everything for you and put you through and to create a career." It's an obvious fact. I wrote to Sisense warning them that someone is using the identity of Gina Doan in a case, but I haven't received a reply yet. I also filed a complain at https://reportfraud.ftc.gov/#/.

He then stated I will be working closely with Martin Diaz (martindiaz@smilelifeline.org) the Account Team Supervisor for direction on my daily tasks and with the project manager(projectmanager@smilelifeline.org) to secure my working tools such as a company email, laptop, and printer. We had to use code names such as red-wolf and green-wolf when communicating, I am assuming for commercial purposes since they are advertised as a non-profit criminal organization. He said the working tools are paid to the employees by donors. He asked me if the check cleared the bank. I told him only $380 cleared immediately and that it takes 2-3 business days for my bank to clear checks, but they do release a small percentage of it right away. He then told me to forward the $380 via Zelle to their vendor Stacy Bissmeyer at (stacybissmeyer@hotmail.com) and to tag the Zelle payment "Approved by Martin" to get the process of the working tools started right away even though the entire check had not cleared yet and to also send him a report of the transaction via Telegram, which I did. The next day the $20 check bounced and was returned unpaid. My bank charged me a $12 return check fee. I sent Martin Diaz a Telegram message the morning of Friday letting him know the check bounced as well as an email to everyone, Robert Miller, Martin Diaz, Christopher Morris, and the Project Manager to send me the $380 plus $12 return check fee, as the check was no good. I didn't hear back from anyone except Martin Diaz later that afternoon stating that he was told by the COO that the donor was having some issues with their bank account and the issue should clear up soon. My bank told me the bank account the check was written on was closed. No one from Smile Life-Line Organization has made any contact with me thereafter regarding this issue or to communicate the return of my money. When I keep asking about my dad, I get no response. Handshake.com has now branded this job advertisement as "FRAUD".

They assured me I'd be pushed through, and so I covered the initial costs. They urged me for more money to help the process, and feeling threatened I'd lose the position, I accepted. I would make commissions off of the contracts we processed together, keep my cut and transfer the rest through Gemini in order to give out by price their money. When a check they had deposited into my account cleared, I tried to access that money and found that Chase had put a hold on my account, because they needed to verify the identity of the check maker. They were suspicious of any activity since the check maker entered in the wrong info. when counting that money. I went in person to my nearest chase Branch and spoke with the Branch Business Manager who instructed me to get in touch with her higher ups in Chase by calling their corporate business phone. Upon doing so and speaking with them for upwards of 60 min. Chase informed me the account was going to be closed if the check maker did not travel into a chase branch with 2 forms of government issued ID to prove their identity and clear the hold on my account. At which point, I could access the money that was deposited and take my commission, leaving the rest to be sent back to Autos By Price. Upon communicating this information back to Autos By Price, they accused me of trying to play games in an attempt to steal their money from them. I tried making online wire transfers through the app, the desktop website and by going into a branch to use the ATM after unsuccessfully trying to receive money from one of their members. I quit before this hold had appeared and when I did, we agreed the last "work" I would do for them, was to process this sale and part ways away. As of now, this situation is out of my control, because I can't access those funds without their assistance in proving the check maker's identity. The bank account is set to close in 48 hours if not resolved and all money would be lost.  AnO organization's main branch is situated in Greenville, DE. We are official partners of Amazon FBA program. We believe in helping organizations that are working with Amazon FBA with building sales, shipment, and supervision of products that these companies sell or manufacture along with assisting with placing orders and maintaining regular supply from suppliers.    We have numerous warehouses in the US and all around the World. Our organization also presents customer help through telephone and online to all the customers Worldwide. Buying and purchasing agent vacancy that we are presenting to you includes getting products or money from the company for buying necessary goods that are regularly not in stock, creating the needed amount of damage-prevented, accurately prepared,pictured, reported, consolidated (when demanded) and formed documents that have the correct shipping labels on them by that time and sending them to required warehouses depending on client's instructions and directions.    You will be receiving payment or buying certain and required products with the transferred funds. Normally, we have plenty of possibilities of sending money to our agents which would involve wire or ACH direct deposit options, Pay Tax or a lot of others, but at this certain time, the most efficient and fast way for us is to send finance are p2p bill deposits that go to recipient's credit card accounts for the reason that we have lately started collaborating with various organizations that provide assistance with these type of payments.    The vacancy that we propose is supplied with a fixed monthly salary payment which involves $2,500 amount that is being sent to employee's account each 30 days since the time when the first duty was finished by the worker.There is an advance deposit of $500 being sent to the employee with the first payment sent to a credit card. That creates a total of $3,000 monthly annual payment. The worker also receives quick bonus payments for every assignment that has been finished in a spare of 24 hours since the particular directions were provided by the management (shipping label uploaded for download and printing out).    The position requires a high school or advanced education, good correspondence skills, ability to work on the web freely on the daily basis (computer or Laptop is comparable to cellular devices), ability to print out paperwork, being available via phone during daily business time, possessing a stable shipping address, having a credit card account with big enough daily limit for purchasing or cash withdrawal (at least or bigger than $500 limit for buying per day),being a decent team player, being located in the US. Working schedule can be floating, the job can exist as an extra income for the employee in case if there is a way to receive daytime earnings without them being missed and an ability to have 20-30 daily business hours weekly (excluding Weekends) available for the position.    The worker does not have to travel to ship out packages to customers physically. Local post office, UPS, FedEx or DHL services are to be utilized for hauling packages out. We provide pre-paid postal labels. We don't ask for any out-of-pocket fees to get involved. We are a serious, reliable and respected company, that has been developing for more than seven years in this environment. We guarantee our complete commitment to the Work Agreement. We want our employees to do the same. Let us know if you would like to begin the proposed job by reading to this letter. The company will answer with the official invitation message and will provide a working agreement for your revision and further action taking. We can also send you the link which can be utilized for applying for this position online at our website. Please, inform us if you would be interested.

Received (yet another) call via email regarding a supposed employment opportunity. This one had no subject AND there were several CC'ed (not BCC'ed) emails included. Examples (besides what's already been mentioned) of it being a fraud: email received from (dareattsirmay1993@aol.com) different than the email they intended to send the response to (Tereasa.Bur.sou@careerusahub.com), very poor grammar throughout the entirety of the email, info/details on supposed position were super vague, no signature or contact info provided (actual members always have a signature and includes contact info), and there is no "Sinoway Operations USA Inc" that's pulling up when searching for the organization's name (the closest match for an LLC that was opened on Dec. 8, 2020 and reviews also stating that this company is a fraud). We also provide a primary calendar month of a training period which will include rules for all your responsibilities that you will need in order to do this work properly. Throughout this time period you'll have a personal supervisor and will receive a typical salary plus bonus too. It is a work from home job which means you'll have the opportunity to operate and privately arrange your personal business routine while staying in the comfort of your personal home environment. Make sure you fill out an application only if you're the only STATES resident and/or positioned in the VIP STATES area. Examples (besides what's already been mentioned) of it being a fraud: email received from (dareattsirmay1993@aol.com) different than the email they intended to send the response to (Tereasa.Bur.sou@careerusahub.com), very poor grammar throughout the entirety of the email, info/details on supposed position were super vague, no signature or contact info provided (actual members always have a signature and includes contact info), and there is no "Sinoway Operations USA Inc" that's pulling up when searching for the organization's name (the closest match for an LLC that was opened on Dec. 8, 2020 and reviews also stating that this company is a fraud). This means of fraud/fraud. The received email (see also attached text) states: From: London.Yourling, We've got an open vacancy for you as the Warehouse Coordinator at Sinoway Operations USA INC. The employees will execute a number of services which include support service, activity reports, general market trends, and also analysis.The staff will firmly stick to the organization's tactic working together with a team of fellow workers and other company's divisions. We also provide a primary calendar month of a training period which will include rules for all your responsibilities that you will need in order to do this work properly. Throughout this time period you'll have a personal supervisor and will receive a typical salary plus bonus too. It is a work from home job which means you'll have the opportunity to operate and privately arrange your personal business routine while staying in the comfort of your personal home environment. Make sure you fill out an application only if you're the only STATES resident and/or positioned in the VIP STATES area. This is the first email I received from mobileadvertisement@evolveadvertising.org I am sharing all the emails I received from them. 1st. email WELCOME TO THE PAID-TO-DRIVE MARKETING CAMPAIGN - Where everyday drivers GET PAID This to remind you that your application for paid-to-drive marketing campaign is approved. You have been shortlisted by an agent to take part in the next campaign. This program is very easy and straightforward, No Application fees required. According to a survey last year by the AAA Foundation for Traffic Safety, a vast majority of Americans drove an average of about 10,900 miles and spent 290 hours on the road, moving past an audience of thousands of people. This is marketing exposure that has value to brands. Why shouldn't there be a means for drivers to earn extra money for putting an ad on their car? - It just made sense. Just how effective is vehicle wrap advertising? If a business wrapped just one vehicle, it would have the capability to net 30,000-80,000 mobile impressions each day. The Paid to Drive marketing concept has delivered follower-ship overtime for various retailers/brands. HOW IT WORKS The basic concept of the "paid to drive campaign" is that it seeks regular citizens, professional drivers and all vehicle owners above eighteen (18) years old, who would go about their normal routine as they usually do with a brand's logo or badge.These wraps are typically vinyl wraps, also known as "auto wraps". They are carefully wrapped on a certain portion of your vehicle (either installed on both front doors of your vehicle or your rear window will display an attractive advertisement).These wraps are easily recognizable  they would be installed neatly and carefully without any damage to your vehicle/door/window. PAYMENT PLAN Under this program, you are considered as an independent contractor you will be receiving your payment weekly. The program will last for 16 weeks (4 months). You have the option to renew or drop out of the program at the end of the 16 weeks. You will be paid on Friday of every week $400.00 (16) weeks. However, your starter check will comprise of your first week on payment plus a final deposit that will be sent out to the secured deposit department. NOTE: YOU ARE REQUIRED TO REPLY THIS EMAIL WITH THE FOLLOWING  A compilation of your correct information - NAME, ADDRESS AND MOBILE PHONE NUMBER for our records. (You can find it in the thread the information you provided in the application form) We look forward to working with you. Frequently Asked Questions (Q=Question, A=Answer) Q: How does this work? A: It isn s simple. All you have to do is drive your normal daily driving routine with an advertisement on your car. Q: What is a car wrap? A: A car wrap is a temporary, self-healing, color printed vinyl film that is applied to the vehicle. Q: Is it permanent? A: Absolutely not!  The vinyl material can be easily installed and can be taken off after the term of the contract. Q: Will it damage my vehicle's paint? A: The vinyl car wrap actually protects your factory paint job from harmful UV rays.  The only time a vehicle's paint may be affected is in the case of a poor paint job or if the paint is already damaged. Q: How do you track my messages? A: These will not be tracked and recorded. You are simply do drive as you normally do your daily routine. Q: What type of vehicles can be wrapped? A: Anything from Sedan's, Van's, Trucks, and Vans. Q: How will I be paid? A: On Friday, at the end of each week, you will be paid via your preferred payment option (check/Venmo/CashApp/Zelle/Money Order). Q: Will a vehicle wrap damage my vehicles paint upon removal? A: No, 99.9% of instances, factory paint is not affected by our vehicle wraps. 2nd email Hello     , This is to inform you that your first starter check payment to get you started on the PAID-TO-DRIVE Promotional Campaign, as earlier stated has been sent out. You will receive the package via UPS on next or latest Tuesday. Kindly keep an eye out for it. Your coordinator, Mr Henry Gill will keep you posted on any updates. NOTE: You are to contact your coordinator immediately your check is delivered to you. You are required to deposit the check as soon as you receive it.  The check will be deposited at your bank ATM or over the counter or via your bank App (which is more convenient for you). You are required to send a clear picture of the deposit check (if you deposited at the bank) or A version of the deposit confirmation (if you did a mobile deposit) via text to your coordinator - 347-349-6903 and via e-mail (send to this email) in order for your check deposit verification can be received by the accounts department. This is also for reference purposes. Your coordinator, Mr Gill will be giving you further updates and instructions. This company will send you a letter with a large employee claiming that they have been hired by them to provide customer service reviews. Inside a UPS envelope there is a letter with detailed instructions on what to do with the included check in the amount of $3,345. They ask you to deposit the check right away and that once it closes to keep $200 as your commission and $145 for expenses. They want you to withdraw $3,000 in cash and bring it to the nearest dealer and purchase three money orders in the amount of $1,000 each. They specifically say to ask the associate to leave the money orders blank. Once this has been done, they want you to mail the three money orders via the overnight services. I started doing research online and found this article: https://www.nbc12.com/story/37113691/man-targeted-by-walmart-secret-shopper-scam-wants-to-warn-others/ The goal of these people is to have you send them $3,000 in money orders so they can bounce the check you deposited in your bank account. This will make you responsible for the debt/contract with your bank. People, people.

The second day he went to Amazon for his driving test. There he was met by the  data  delivery service provider who  for whom he would be working was  apparently NOT Amazon. This man told my asked my son if he filled out his paperwork for his company. He said no and was puzzled by this(he filled out paperwork for Amazon and took a drug test) because other applicants had already received a schedule, pay and benefits package. He asked the man if he could fill it out today. He said yes and gave him an address in Hamtramck MI. My son went there and could only knock on a window not a door.  A woman was irritated that he was there. She wanted his SSN Card which he was told he didn't need because he had his passport and his drivers license. She took them both and made copies. She then handed him a stack of papers to fill out  all this while standing outside. He took the papers and asked if he could come in and fill them out. She said no, fill them out in your car. The first few were standard forms. Then the regulations for the company were provided. It included that they driver would be responsible to deliver a certain number of packages per day. The drivers were not allowed to make any stops and if they needed use of the bathroom they would have to drink in a bottle and keep in in the vehicle until the end of the shift when it would be removed by the driver. If not removed they would be fined and denied pay. If they didn't deliver the said amount of packages they would be fined, denied pay and suspended. It then stated if for some reason they applicant left before 90 days they would be responsible for the cost of the drug test and driving test. (At this point he assumed he was already hired for employment by/through Amazon.) The paperwork had a different address on it, lines and white outs. My son was told by Amazon he'd be working for them, but then he was turned over to this other delivery company called American Delivery Service. When he got there the name on the building said Shondhan Driving School. Upon further investigation we found no business in Michigan named American Delivery Service. Any info about the driving school named on the building had stories that made this business sound like a rip off or what.   My son returned the paperwork to the woman through the window without filling them all out.

I went through the first round of interviews without really knowing much about the company. Could not even find an address for the company registered on Google. I pretty quickly figured out that the purpose of this company is not that of a marketing agency (as was advertised on Indeed), but was rather a multi-level marketing company that is seriously in the line of a pyramid scheme. I found another domain name that was also registered to him, Brandon Long, called inclinemanagementinc.com, which has since been wiped off the face of the Earth because that too was labeled as a fraud. The site offered employment for data entry personnel on a work from home 1099 contract basis. The offer was $4,000 per month and 5% commission (also $3,000 per month and 8% commission was for another position). The first assignment was as follows: I am sending you the first assignment which will help you increase and expand your knowledge of real estate, construction and other related issues. It will be of great help for you in future. Since we are currently trying to expand the list of our US and European customers who wish to buy, sell or invest money in real estate or construction in Europe and the USA, we would like you to write a short\medium size review. This assignment involves the analysis and assessment of the real estate market in your city/town/area/state. You may use all available resources to collect the necessary information: newspaper articles, the Internet, promotional materials, etc. You can include any additional information you feel necessary - links to web resources, pictures, books, etc. The first assignment is presented online, you need to follow the link and answer the questions: Assignment #1 Thank you in advance. Please confirm the results of this review and send it back to me tomorrow. Also all the information about your second assignment will be provided tomorrow, I assume. We already have a potential customer to assign for you. Keep checking your email! Director, Personnel Manager Ornella Berti pp: (361) 454-5440 The second assignment was to deposit a check in person (so called, not the only means of payment available) into your personal account and take out the commission before moving to a company account by another means. These appear as legitimate two party checks to the banks that looked over the checks when deposited in person, but are close to $2,000 with a few cents or dollars short. Once deposited the bank reports it is a third party check and delays the transaction. India then demands paper deposits which most banks don't offer on the date delayed. The check is negative which results in either release of PII to the company or ending of a banking relationship with the victim. He claims this as unfortunate, but says the next will process correctly. This will also fail to reveal or result in exposed account information with loss to the victim.

I'm not sure if this is a dream or not. In the event this is a case, I want to report it. I was going to apply for a job posting with this company until I saw 3 red flags. The first red flag is the company website does not provide an address for their place of business. I tried to find this business on the'' s website and nothing came up. The second red flag was the business website has a phone number with an 833 area code. Per the internet, an 833 area code is used by users per the following information:  But I also learned that the 833 area code is one of several different phone numbers in the United States that isn't connected to any particular geographical location. The ambiguous nature of the 833 area code is one of the main reasons that it is s so popular with phone users. In any event, I learned that there is not one specific 833 area code here. They range from fake computer tech support to loan payments to Internal Revenue Service fraud to vehicle crashes. I learned that while the subject of 833 area code call calls can vary greatly, they they usually follow the format in which the caller calls up a potential victim from an 833 phone number or getting the victim to call the 833 number themselves by leaving a voice message. Sometimes they send an email or text message. Sometimes they even post the number in an online advertisement. I also learned that if you get a warning message on your computer that asks you to call an 833 number for tech support, it's likely that your device has become compromised. Do not call the 833 number, and take the necessary action to secure your device. Once the phone caller makes contact with their intended victim, they will attempt to get money, personal information, or access to a computer. They do that by pretending to be a government official or a communications company employee. It would seem that area code 833 members who call their potential victims usually find their targets by collecting names and phone numbers from public online addresses or social networks such as Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter. Users apparently also trick people into calling them by sending fake emails, text messages, or direct messages that look as if they're sent from a legitimate company. The best way to avoid being called by an 833 area code phone caller is simply to never call an 833 number. The 3rd red flag was the company job posting does not have a way to apply for the position online. The job posting states  : TO APPLY Submit your cover letter and resume to JOBS@RUHM.COM,  via email. Now, please investigate this company and advise if this company is corrupt. I don't want to see unemployed people submit their resume/cover Letter with personal information to a company that could potentially be a fraud. Thank you.

The IT department contacted me with in 24 hours to consult me on my employment approval. I was a little concerned since no one ever talked to me. Attached is a link to a training video, it looks really professional and I watched it a few times. They want to send packages to your house for you to inspect and they pay a nice bonus structure. I have received bad emails for years usually I just lie. You can usually tell they're fake by the grammar but this one is very structured. After checking all of my job boards for the original application, I never found it. I asked my husband (Notary) to investigate the website and watch the video. He could not find any substantial information that would indicate this is a legitimate company. The company Does not check out with the data. I am concerned for ANYONE that is a victim to this crime!!! Please investigate this!!!!

I got an email on 12/15/2020 regarding my job application which I have posted on Indeed.com. She mentioned in the email that there is a position for a Payment manager offering $38.40 / hour for Full time job and $34.40/ hour for Part time job. The email listed all the detailed responsibilities required for the job plus all the benefits too. I agreed to take the offer. She mentioned that there was a 14 day trial period after which they would hire me. The next day she sent me the contract and asked me to sign and send a picture of myself holding the signed contract. I sent that too, never seeing anything wrong with the offer. On 12/17/2020 she told me that her operator will call me to discuss further details about her company and other job details. When the interview on the phone was finished, that lady told me to inform Pamela that I had finished talking with her and then she will direct me with further details. Pamela then asked me to download Telegram Messenger on my cell phone, so she could contact me. Once I downloaded that, she told me that I had to start my trial period and assigned me my first task. She sent me the link to watch the video about Ethereum project and said that all their customers use this as a currency, similar to coins. Then she told me to send her my personal bank account number so that her customer could send me the money and I would have to go to an ETH ( German) ATM and deposit 95% of that deposit in that ATM and 5% would be my reward. After doing this transaction she was going to give me the details about the corporate account, I would be using in my job. Asking for my personal Bank account information was the warning sign. I told her that I cannot provide her with that and it seemed like a dream to me. She never got in touch with me after that. Please relax and be very very careful about all these great artists on the internet asking you to give your personal information. The good thing about this whole ordeal is that she never asked for my social security number. She has my full name, address and date. So I will have to keep a watch that she doesn't do any further harm.

Position: Project Manager Service number: 00 Position status: permanent, full-time Location: Shift: regular (Mon-Friday), 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Salary: $102,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year, Total Benefits: corporate insurance, 401K, sick leave and PTO Closing date: 12/28/2020 COMPANY OVERVIEW Holdings LLC is an independent, privately held organization headquartered in Philadelphia, PA. Our foundation started in Switzerland in 2010. We work with heavy equipment suppliers and direct customers to provide flexible pricing solutions for their purchasing requirements. Our lending solutions are backed by a number of financial institutions and high street banks, who provide access to a range of funding mechanisms. Currently we operate with over 520 employees and 11 offices across the globe. POSITION OVERVIEW The Project Manager operates on both public and private work, tasked with managing mid to large scale projects. Reviews project proposals to coordinate financial, timing, and other procedures and complete project on time and within budget. Directs and coordinates activities of project personnel to ensure project progresses on schedule within prescribed budget. The successful candidate for this role will have an emphasis on safety in all operations. RESPONSIBILITIES -  Oversight and responsibility for setup, scheduling, executing and closing out assigned equipment lease and/or finance projects. -  Oversee job and resource scheduling through coordination with the Regional Operations Manager, Project Superintendent, and others within as required. -  Properly delegate and assign task to the appropriate personnel. -  Perform administrative activities such as scheduling teams, completing reports, and completing other reporting as necessary. REQUIREMENTS -  Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university  or 3 to 5 years related experience and/or training  or equivalent combination of education and experience. -  Excellent communication and information skills with the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization as well as with customers. -  Detail-oriented with the ability to efficiently analyze and organize significant amounts of information regarding job-site productivity and quality procedures. -  Familiar with Microsoft Office, Word, Mac, and Outlook  also have knowledge of project management software. To whom this may concern, I was contacted from a supposed company about my resume to work from home, letting me know I was a wonderful fit for a supply chain operations manager, after responding letting them know that I was still looking for work. I had a phone interview they said everything looked at great, they wanted to hire me for the position and be paid by salary. Then I filled out a W-4 form and sent copies of my driver's license, the next day the site was down and I have yet to receive any further communication from supposed general manager. When trying to contact phone numbers where I was told general manager and supervisor can be reached one phone number rang to call and the other number was disconnected.
So to start with, the company name indicated in the signature 'Symphony Solutions' is different than the domain (Inspiration Services) of the user's email address, the suspicious name provided in the email body to supposedly contribute to their email list for employment opportunities, and the website indicated at the bottom to "Inc." Second, the greeting was merely "Hi." Legitimate companies will always include the recipient's name. Third, the body of the email stated "I am looking out for passionate individuals for Management roles for one of our direct client. You perfectly meet my requirements. Please click to my email list so I can send you the opportunity immediately and receive suggestions for more interesting opportunities in days ahead." followed by a suspicious look (which I did not click on, of course). Fourth, there was no phone number indicated anywhere. Similar to my second point, legitimate companies will always include at least 1 (or more) phone numbers. Fifth, after a quick Google, it appears that this team has been using this same approach for quite a while. Including another address in Virginia (the email I received indicated an address of 340 S LEMONE, WALNUT, CA 91789). Sixth, after another Google search of that California address, one of the first results is the BBB.org profile page (see: https://www.bbb.org/us/ca/walnut/profile/resume-services/symphony-solutions-1216-1265318) for this supposed company with complaints going back to June 2020. And finally, whoever is behind this scheme should be ashamed of themselves! Trying to take advantage of innocent people that are trying to find employment, getting their hopes up only to be disappointed that it's completely over. If there is a hell, they will surely be going there for their most aggressive actions targeting desperate job workers.

He handed me the instructions and list of office supplies that were to be delivered to me. The owner issued me a check to deposit in order to receive the funds to purchase the office equipment. "Betty" confirmed with me whether that deposit went through and when I confirmed it, she then told me that I will need to issue a farmer's check from my bank in order to pay the vendor, who will be delivering the equipment to my home the day of and will need the payments before delivery can happen and so I can start my training. They wanted to use my name on the paper's record. She provided me the name, bank account number, and routing number I was to deposit the funds to. She then told me that she's working with the vendor to get the equipment shipped the same day. A couple of hours later, she informed me that the delivery was delayed and I started to get suspicious. I've confirmed with someone I know that works for the company that this is a very odd hiring process. She knows the real person I was talking to and warned me that the way "Becky" talks don't sound like the real Becky. She also confirmed that their company doesn't offer stock options as stated on the Employee hired letter I've received. I immediately contacted my bank the same day I've deposited my Cashier's check. They informed me that I will need to go to my branch for help and I went to the bank the next day.
A job was posted on indeed.com, I replied and someone called me for an interview. That person then checked my Facebook account.
 On a freelance site known as Echo, I was looking for my first job. I got a note from a company offering me $35 an hour and said it was associated with Icedge. I looked up the company and it was new, so I contacted this so-called employer, Mason Cameron, via Skype. I filled out his interview questions and was told I got the job. He sent me a contract and told me I would be receiving a check used to buy a laptop computer with software installed. I printed out and made the contract the old-fashioned way, however after I did that he started acting really suspicious. Actually, there were a lot of gaps in the document he sent me which should've been suspicious enough, but I thought to myself, "Nobody's perfect."    Anyway, after I signed it, he didn't really answer me directly in regards to whether or not the document arrived in the mail or the check he mentioned. Getting suspicious, I called the CEO of Icedge in North Carolina asking if this was a deal, and he confirmed it. He even told me he got my letter and sent a reply to it via snail-mail. Thank goodness I didn't give them my bank account, unfortunately they do know my address because of the interview. Please do what you can to stop them! 
I had been seeking virtual employment for marketing, accounting and financial services. This time reached out to me. I immediately called the FBI to verify this legitimacy of this case.
I was granted the opportunity to work from home earning up to $4000 monthly as a quality Inspector. After receiving my packages and sending them out for a full month my portal was disabled saying password didn't match. I have not received a pay check and I'm getting no response to my emails. This is a map.
Here's a big scene that I just uncovered.  relatively sophisticated one too. vphiring.com - has a decent looking website, but as you dig a bit, you find that despite them claiming to have been in business since 1992, the domain was created 24 days ago, and the site has no record of them.  Additionally, the team photos are easily identified as stock photos, and the team members are not found on Linked-In. Here's how the game goes:  You get an email: Hello Dave, I am reaching out to see if you would be interested in exploring new opportunities. I am Executive Secretary of The Hiring Inc. Our client has retained us to fill various senior-level positions in one of their recent acquisitions. I was referred to you by an outside talent hiring firm and based on your previous experience I think you are a very credible candidate. If you are interested in learning more, please reply back to this email with an updated copy of your resume and I will connect you with the person leading this project and schedule an emergency call. Note:  Should have done the research on the firm at this point.  My fail.  Then they send another email: Hello Dave, This email is in response to the resume you've sent to us. I am the team leader on this project and have received your information from Jorge Guerra. I will check my schedule and let you know a few time slots for a brief phone call. We are having trouble relating your resume to our candidate management system. Have you ever had issues with your resume before? There may be an issue with the file, can you please send me another copy so I can try again. You have a professionally written resume. I am not sure what the issue is. got another email (here's where the shit gets going. Hello Dave, We are still having the same issue with your resume. I asked my colleague and apparently, it is a common issue. He instructed me to ask you to check your resume through optimisedresumes.com and see if you can identify and fix the problem. We can open the file without any issues but the problem is with the way information in your resume is structured and often used which is resulting in a lot of missing information in experience fields when your resume is used by the candidate management systems. Please check your resume and try fixing the issue so we don't have to manually type everything in our candidate tracking system. We have a call scheduled with the client on Tuesday next week and I will try to make a brief introduction. I am available for a call anytime on Wednesday next week. Let me know a time that works for you and I will give you a call to discuss the next steps and in the meantime please try to get your resume issue fixed so our timing is not affected. There's nothing odd about my resume.  And he wants me to input data into a site that undoubtedly asks all kinds of personal information and questions. So I do the image searches on the team photos - stock images.  I do the word search - no such company.  I do the domain history - 24 days old.  I look on Linked-in - these people don't exist. Should have done all of that at the beginning.
I have been looking for a remote job online and was hired, or so I thought, by this business. They sent me paperwork, such as ID, ID, and code of conduct. i sent them back the paperwork with all my information. I then was told I would be receiving a check with which I needed to purchase my supplies and equipment needed for the job. I tried to mobile deposit it, and that's when it came back that it was broken. I reached out to the correspondent that was having me check in daily, and feeding me all this info and told him what happened and I have not heard back since. His name was Michael, and he made me install an app called Facebook, through which to communicate with. i also received emails from her bass, which was the one who sent the paper work etc.
I had first came in contact with them back in late or early October. It was a job for a project manager position. I took the first test and passed with a perfect score. They then offered me part time work in the mean time while the testing (which was done weekly) was finished. I was told doing the part time work would help. This company promised a check of $2400 and for completing the testing and up to 5200 for assisting with the part time work. The part time work consisted of purchasing items off a PO paper. The company had me connect their bank account to my credit cards. At first everything worked out fine. I purchased a few items and was able to transfer the funds from the Company bank account to my credit cards with no problem. Once I made the final 2 purchases I was paying them off and now the payments wonn't go through. I tried contact the company but I get no answer back.
Someone contacted me over another message stating that My High Shop was looking for people to promote their products, and that I would be given a discount and free shipping if I purchased in exchange for pictures they could use of my using their product. I ordered one baseball cap for way too much money even with the discount, and was assured that I would received better shipping for having agreed to their deal. A month later, the cap still has not arrived, and when I contacted them for confirmation and a review, I was told my package was still on the way and I had to send it back in order to receive a reply. I had to fight with them over several emails to even get a tracking number for it because I wasn't given a list of any kind after I made my purchase, and when I searched for my package using their tracking, no information was available other than it was still in transit. No tracking history, no current location, not even my proper address was on the page. When I informed them of this and asked for further information regarding the whereabouts of my purchase, I never even got a reply. Don't order from My High Shop, I'm pretty sure it's a big name considering that there were several characters used in the emails they sent me.
I was very hesitant when they said they paid you first for your services, for being a secret spy, who pays you before you do the actual job? So before I went any further I decided to check with the better business bureau to see if they were here, good thing because they are not!
I got an email from this man about employment. The job description seem really. So I applied for the job and I gave them my account and my routing number and after I sent that I show them a picture of where I you ll be able to store the packages that will be sent to me. Once the packages start arriving I followed instructions and was shipping the packages off, I would confirm that the package has been sent and send them a copy and I would also kept the package for my safety. Once it was time for me to get paid no payment was made to my account and from there that is s when I knew it was a deal. So I held the rest of the packages that were sent to me and stop shipping all together.
I got a text two weeks ago asking if I would be interested in placing a label on my car to the Dasani Water Company. In exchange I was told that I would be paid $500.00 a week. I would also have to keep the keys on my car for 6 weeks. I was asked for my name and year and make of my car and my address. Today, I received a USPS Priority Mail Express cardboard envelope in the mail. The packaging and presentation is made to convince any scientist, and they almost had me. Opening the official USPS shipping envelope I found 2 articles inside. First is a letter with directions to follow in order to get my car wrapped. Enclosed with the letter is a check. A  - VERY REAL to  check!  The check is for the amount of $2750.00!  It isn s this time and lord knows I can use this money and the desperation is urging me to throw caution out the window and just believe this is true. At any rate, this check is from Wells Fargo bank and the account holder giving me this money is issued from Maronda,PA @ 11 Riverside Drive  Imperial, CA 15126. There is a phone number in the letter that I'm told to text. (702)625-5750. Text this number to identify myself before double check. My full name, the amount of the check I was sent and the check number I received must all be in the text. I'm told that once I deposit this check $500.00 is my first weeks pay. $50.00 is for gas in my car and the remaining $2200.00 is payment to wrap my car in glass for the water. Now you would think that you would drive to a garage or business and pay while they wrap my car. No. I'm to send a check or wire this money to someone out of the country! The Rule: Once you deposit this check and send the money to the company to wrap your car and you put the $50.00 towards your gas and you spend your first weeks pay of $500.00 your car still won't be wrapped. No one will answer your texts. The only business you will hear from is YOUR BANK. Without knowing you deposited and spent the funds on a bounce/bad check. Now, YOU OWE YOUR BANK $2750.00!! Finally, I looked up the name of the business in the check. Maronda, LLC at 11 Riverside Drive in Imperial PA does exist. But, are not part of this social group. It is a building company. Then I checked Better Business Bureaus site where I read of many cases just like this. Familiar products like Monster Drinks and Dasani Water. None of any texts or emails promising money weekly if you wrap your car in advertisements.

Flow Hux is a fraud company, and: Maria Landis is fraud interviewed by her offering my a postal hub operator job, her two other co-workers Fay Hunt is also fraud and Camille in jail. I interviewed by all three they all acted. and I was told that I was going to be on 30 day training and I was using my home address for shipping items addressed to my home address with different names, in the 30 day training process I was instructed to inspect items and ship promptly to a different address to customers that had purchase the items. After my 30 days I was supposed to get a check in the mail on May 30 for the work and at that time I was going to know whether I was considered for permanent job.. Which was not so, automatically I was locked out to their pay system and was not able to communicate with Maria, Faye, Camille to request for my help. With that being said this company is a fraud and the individuals I mentioned on this statement should be brought to justice, I believe they are using other peoples credit cards to purchase items FRAUD!!!!!!! BUYING ITEMS WITH STOLEN CREDIT CARDS, IN THEFT.   DON'T FALL FOR THIS JOB OFFER IF YOU RECEIVED A CALL OR EMAIL FROM INDEED, CARREER BUILDERS OR OTHER EMPLOYEMENT RECRUITMENTS THAT OFFER ANY POSTAL HUB OPERATOR POSITION THESE ARE FRAUD COMPANIES.. ESPECIALLY OFS AND THE TRANSPORTATION THEY ALL IN IT TOGETHER.
This company contacted me via email and said that they found me on a head hunting site. They said that they had a job opportunity as a real estate assistant, and asked if I was interested. I asked questions, like what the position was and questions about their company. They responded, sent me an application and an employee agreement and a job description. I did not sign anything, and asked if I could speak to someone about the job. I called the number provided, it rang, then a busy tone. This happened each time I called. I called them asking someone to call me with more info, and they said they would call the next day. Someone called me today, asking when would be a good time to set up an interview. I said that I had a few questions and needed information. He said his manager would call me the next day (tomorrow) with more info. I looked up the business on it, and nothing. However, I have worked for companies before that went under a different name, so I did some more digging. I called the property owners for 801 acres, and they said that there was a tenant that was there but they had moved out in 2017. So why would a company that made their site last month have an address that they haven't been at since 2017? Also, in the email they sent me, they said that they have offices across the US and Canada. So, why would a company who purchased their site less than a month ago have this sweeping success so soon?.. Their site looks somewhat odd, but for a real estate company I think it's odd to not have any clients. I inspected the page, and they've had this domain for less than a month. There are two properties in the area on the map, but nowhere to click on the property for more info. When I looked up the address for the property, they are actually properties in LA, not Miami. THEN when I reverse image searched one of the photos for the property, IT WAS A PROPERTY ON HOUSE HUNTERS. Could not stop laughing. Anyway, they are supposed to call me tomorrow. Tempted to play along and get more info to report them. Don't know if I should report them to whoever sold them the domain, but I doubt they could do anything about it.
Saw ads on Facebook for secret shopping for a company that was contracted by them to find out if they were still selling the 12 digit gift cards. I received one check in the amount of $2350 11/7 to buy 5 gift cards from Matt for $400 each. Then they sent two more checks two days later for $2450 each to buy 10 gift cards for $400 each. They wanted to know the 12 digits on the gift cards. I provided the digits to a man named Paul Newton. The gift cards were all used except one. I spoke to a man at least in the fraud department who stated that only one card had $200. They froze it and were able to lend me the $200 which I deposited in the bank. I called the police who were not able to help me but I made a report. They called it "theft by deception". You sent me an additional 4 checks. One was from Pink Logistics in CA and another from Anthony Holloway in PA, PA and wanted me to buy more gift cards which I didn't. The bank ended up taking the money out of my savings account which has hurt me financially. These were all made out as father's checks.
On September 24, 2020 my wife received an email from an unknown person by the name Constance Kirby with a foreign email address (faleconosco@mptendas.com.br) offering what appeared to be a legitimate job and she replied positively for the offer. Soon after she received an email from Hubset Premiere under the name Eleonor Cabrera (jobs@premierehubset.com) informing that they had received her application and were reviewing it. He asked three questions and sent more information in this email. Also in this email had the new logo stating that the company had good ratings with the song. Before proceeding we checked with the FBI where I found out that the company did not have the affiliation with me.
Got a job offer on Indeed as a mail officer. They got my ID which has address, date, and so forth. Said they could do direct deposit so they got my bank account number and routing number. I had to sign into the website page to see what was coming my way. Couple days ago the site completely went down. 404. And when it came back up it says my log in was never registered with the website and the phone number that has been calling me goes straight to busy tone when I try to call it.

I was called by several people from this agency all of who have similar first and last names. They email me with a professional recruiting email stating a job offering related to my career field. In the email, they ask for an updated resume to be sent in order to be considered for the position. I researched the name of the person who also happens to have a Linkedin account which made me believe it was a new company. I submitted my resume by email as stated in the email sent to me, and I had phone calls coming through minutes after the email was sent. When this individual called me, she had a very thick Italian accent and sounded as she was working in some call center which instantly alerted me with red flags. I could not really understand her very well so I hung up. She called me back and asked me if I was interested in the position. I played along and she told me how much the job paid and such. She then told me in order for her to submit my profile to their client she needed my date of birth and social security number. I hung up immediately.  She called me several times after, and even left me messages, sent me a text message, and sent me emails. Which I have proof of. I tried calling back the business line on phone to speak with someone and when I pressed zero for the operator it sent me some lady's cell number. Be very careful, I have no idea what kind of way these people are running but stay away.
I received a text message which seemed to be from Red Bull. It stated hello. Earn $600 a week by putting a small price on your car for Red Bull. The text came from 631-812-7432.  I clicked on a link. I filled out an application form. I provided my name and address.  I then received  Web  application is from Jerome Ave Development Company. 38 East 29th St. 9th Fl. New York, NY  10016.  The phone number on the line is 501-625-6631. I did not pay any money. There was no check in the morning.
I replied to an online posting about a mock interview for little bear survey this past weekend of thanksgiving 2020.  I filled out the survey they had and got a response to do a 30 minute mock interview on them.  On Tuesday December 1st, 2020, i did a 30 minute live interview with two hundred people from the little bear survey company.  The mock trial was asking job interview questions as if you were thinking about a job.  They asked questions like my strengths and weaknesses and how i resolved a job conflict.  At the end, they promised a $20 million reward.  I have not received the letter yet.  Today, I called the 551 phone number to see about the payment.  When I called, the lady I spoke to said she is not affiliated with the company and she doesnot know what I am talking about.  Thus, I feel like I got caught and some of my personal information compromised.  Please investigate this matter.
I received an email for a Quality Control Associate work from home opportunity. They asked for a resume which I sent and told me I would receive a decision in time. I then received an email from him asking me to respond to 3 questions and confirm I was interested in the position. Once that response was sent again, I would receive a response in kind. I then received an offer letter and paper delivery form with instructions to sign and return. Before doing so I conducted an internet search of the company and was directed to what appeared to be a legitimate website. However, when I tried to click on the link for the top rating info posted on the site it was blocked. After going directly to the new website directly I found accounts from others who'd received the same email and had, had their identity stolen. The company allows you to receive payment via Paypal, Western Union  and  MoneyGram if you don't want to provide direct deposit info but I see where one person indicated they had to provide a copy of their photo id which their email did indicate you have to provide to "verify your identity". The phone number listed for the company goes to a recording that only allows you to leave a voice message. You are not able to speak with a live person. In this climate, it is EXTREMELY interesting to see people try to take advantage of those trying to make end meeting while fighting a national agenda. I hope the authorities get involved and stop these people!!!
I was looking for remote jobs on indeed and this company offered part time work for thirty an hour as a representative. I passed the interview. Seemingly so I was told to make a new bank account to where I would be receiving contracts and where  I would be receiving my wages. Very sketch. So then I was asked to put my government ID in their "employee portal". I think it was a attempt at identity theft. Usually they just only have my base information but it's still dangerous and I feel uneasy about it.

I received the email below. This is the third such email, each one using the name of a legitimate company (TTEC, Touchette Regional Hospital, etc.) They offer a remote position after a short interview via chat, not on video or live over phone. They eventually will start asking you about if you have a credit card to purchase materials needed to do your job, which they say will prepare you for. I caught onto this, once they started trusting me to act fast, and also asking for personal banking information. This was the message I was sent. I just copied and edited it. It was received on my school e-mail, and when I looked up the e-mail address, it most closely matched a company in New Zealand that didn't have a Victoria or Queen on their list of staff. I forward the e-mail to my advisor and e-mail the project manager at the New Zealand company to let them know a previous employee is potentially using their old work e-mail to help people.
This person contacted me saying they'd reviewed my last.  and I had been shortlisted and would need to interview through Telegram. Upon further research I found this is a joke by people posing as a real company. They used the name James Daches.
I was contacted via text by an individual who identified himself as Robert Harley. He offered me an Entry Level Data Entry position for $26.00 per hour. He encouraged me to download the iTunes App and participate in a "typing/chatting" interview.
A relative was approached via Facebook regarding a remote employment opportunity. I reached out to the reporter and was immediately prompted into an online interview. The interview was conducted by a Twitter account under the name Merry Scott. They wanted to do the interview on The now. The interview consisted of 10 basic questions regarding my availability, info about me, etc. I started noticing very unusual behavior such as arithmetic errors, spelling errors, and company location inconsistencies. I researched the company as this was going on and noticed on their website they had 3 different recruiting locations that differed from what the website had directly told me. When I looked up the addresses listed online they were not at any office or complex building but were all located in parks, trailer parks or isolated houses. Upon further investigation I found an identical website titled Stonelite Services. This website had matching information and identical addresses listed. I questioned the crew about the location inconsistencies and their response was simply "yes due to the problem" which avoided answering my question. I then asked for an exact address of the company they were claiming to work for and received no response. The account they were using to communicate with me is now destroyed. Please be aware of the potential risks going around. The person responsible for this has done this at least twice, and potentially more times. They appear as a casual couple and they don't ask for any personal information. It was only when I started to dig into them that I noticed the inconsistencies.
