A fast-growing based in the United States delivery partner seeks reliable working at home agents to become a part of their shipping network. It is a permanent job with a pay of $2700 monthly. Job Details: - Monitor the company online account for incoming packages regularly. - Be available at your residential address during business hours Monday through Friday to receive packages. Packages will come through Visa, USPS, and UPS and can include anything from consumer electronics to fashion items. - Verify the photos if the match the description, take pictures and submit via employee account. - Divide or combine items into shipping lots using the information uploaded. - Send out items at FedEx local facility with pre-paid labels. Requirements: - US residential address is necessary. - This is a full-time position. You are required to be at your address from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. - Past education in Shipping is not necessary, the company is ready to provide training. - Be responsible for your tasks and perform as efficient as you can. - Ability to process at least 35 lbs Eager to try? We believe in assisting organizations that are connected to Amazon FBA with maintaining cache, sending, and regulation of products that these organizations acquire or create along with assisting with placing orders and keeping consistent supply from vendors. We own several warehouses in the US and globally. Our enterprise also provides customer assistance through telephone and on the web to all the clients globally. Buying and shipping employee opening that we are offering to you includes obtaining merchandise or funds from the organization for purchasing needed items that are often out of stock, including the demanded amount of damage-controlled, properly packaged,photographed, reported, put together (if demanded) and organized items that have the correct shipping labels on them by that time and re-sending them to certain warehouses based on on customer's location and directions. You will be getting orders or buying necessary and required products with the supplied money. Normally, we have plenty of possibilities of providing finance to our employees which would include wire or ACH direct deposit options, Pay Tax or a lot of others, but at this certain time, the most comfortable and quick way for us is to transfer funds are p2p bill payments that go to recipient's credit card accounts due to that we have recently begun co-operating with different firms that help to make these type of transactions. The vacancy that we propose is set for a settled monthly annual payment which involves $2,500 amount which is being sent to employee's account each 30 days since the day when the initial assignment was done by the employee.There is an advance amount of $500 being sent to the worker with the first deposit attached to a credit card. That creates a total of $3,000 monthly salary payment. The agent also gets quick bonus payments for every task that has been accomplished within 24 hours since the particular directions were provided by the management (postal label provided for booking and printing out). The job opening requires a high school or upper education, good communication abilities, capability to use internet easily on the regular basis (Web or Laptop is comparable to mobile phones and tablets), ability to print out documents, being available via phone during daily business hours, possessing a stable street address, having a credit card account with a decent daily limit for buying or cash withdrawal (at least or more than $500 limit for buying daily),being a decent team member, being located in the United States. Working hours can be floating, the position can exist as an additional income for the employee in case if there is a possibility to get daytime shifts without them being missed and an opportunity to have 20-30 daily business hours weekly (apart from Weekends) dedicated to the position. The employee does not have to drive or go far to send packages to customers himself or herself. Local post office, UPS, FedEx or DHL locations are to be used for sending mail out. We supply pre-paid shipping labels. We don't ask for any out-of-pocket fees to get involved. We are a well-established, reliable and reliable company, that has been constantly working for more than seven years in this environment. We guarantee our full commitment to the Work Contract. We expect our workers to act in the same way. Let us know if you would wish to begin the proposed position by reading back to this proposal. We can also forward you the link which can be utilized for moving forward with the application for this job online at our website. Please, make us aware if you would be interested. Thank you for your attention. Provide a description of the incident and how you were treated. Provide information not captured elsewhere in this complaint form. I applied to a job on Indeed for an Executive Assistant position at a company called Allied Health. About a week or so later I was contacted via my associated email address with an offer for an interview and documentation on the company and the position. I was given instructions on how to proceed by setting up a profile on Wire.com and to connect with someone named "Tiffany Chu". I did this and she set up an interview time for me. She interviewed me entirely via chat, which I thought was strange. She said they would get back to me within a week. I was contacted a little after a week and offered the position and given more information about the operations of the company, the structure of the training process and expectations for the first two weeks. On Monday 8/3/2020 I began what they called "Pre-Training" with a woman named Emma Tabenkin. This all took place via wire and consisted mostly of testing my writing and communication skills. It all seemed very above board. It proceeded the same on 8/4/2020 at first and then took a sharp turn. They had told me previously that as a work remote position they helped with setting up a home office location and they would be sending funds so I could get it set up. On Tuesday (8/4) I was asked to print 2 checks and mobile deposit them so I could purchase the software/security system "online". Despite my irritation at the start of the process I got it done. Immediately they asked me about whether it was deposited. Then they asked me to proceed buying the software. This is where it gets really strange. I was asked to purchase 5 gift cards, from Nordstrom totaling the amount of $2215. I was persuaded into doing this by being forced into going to several different stores until I found them. They then asked me to send them pictures of the cards. I am sorry to say I did all of these things despite my extreme discomfort. It felt wrong and I felt extremely rushed into completing these tasks. I asked them many times to explain why I was doing this and told them many times I was tired and uncomfortable doing it. Emma Tabenkin said we could just pick up the next day, seeing my discomfort. Today I have done nothing but speak to them privately and research if this is a possible case. My bank froze my account today (8/5/2020). I haven't received confirmation on the information there quite yet but they are looking into the situation. (2) checks were mobile deposited totaling $4499.00 and $4490.00 respectively. I was then asked to purchase $2215 worth of Nordstrom gift cards which were broken out like this: (4) $500 (1) $215 At this point I have only really communicated with them until today but they continue to try and reach me via phone. Mainly with listed at the number 347-518-8023 I have possession of all of this communication as well as every gift and gift card still saved.
Got an offer for a job at Media Lab. They send me emails and asked me to conduct an interview through local hang outs. I spoke with a man who claimed his name was John Baxter. I was suppose to fill out forms, with all my information and bank information and sent it back to them. They also sent me a check to pay for the software and supplies I needed to complete the job. They said this was a way to form trust between them and me. When I received the check it said from Retina Group Chicago. I called the bank and they let me know they had received many complaints and failed checks from this business.

I found the company on an employment search site while looking for a remote job during COVID-19. I was freshly out of college and was looking for full-time employment. I ended up getting contacted by Mitch Benson to get an interview. He sent over the interview questions as well as the work contract to give an idea of my responsibilities and the rules of the company. My mother and I had done prior research on the computer to make sure it was clean and the website and information we had found was secure. Some time had passed and I had gotten "hired," I had given them my bank routing number and account number to set up my direct deposit, they had informed me that the first few checks they would send to me would be paper until they could get my direct deposit set up. I had to purchase equipment for the job and was done through a "private vendor," I had to buy little things like phones, work laptop, a printer and other things needed to do my job. I had informed them I did not have the money up front to pay so they said they will give me the money to purchase the equipment. Then they had sent me a total of three checks in the mail and shortly after that a withdrawal that I did not make was made and my account was over $1,400 I was able to pay it off.
FIRST EMAIL : My department hr@premiumlogisticsusa.com via sendgrid.net Friday, Jul 24, 12:52 PM (12 days ago) to me Shipping Agent position We appreciate your interest in joining our company. Below, you you ll find the details of the Shipping Agent position outlined, along with the expected duties and an explanation of our hiring procedure. Premium Logistics USA is a tech-enabled third-party logistics company which provides online mail management and e-commerce logistics solutions. Our innovative approach to shipping gives our customers access to a large network of U.S. suppliers and retail partners in addition to the best shipping rates we can negotiate. Starting logistics operations in the U.S. can often be complex, but our selection process makes setting international distribution easy. Here are just a few examples of who our clients are:? International companies that buy products from U.S. suppliers for distribution in other countries and need their products prepared and consolidated before shipping internationally in order to meet foreign import regulations.? Amazon states that, according to Amazon regulations, need to have their products inspected and prepared according to guidelines before sending their products to Amazon customer centers.? Amazon stores that need inspection and processing of their buyer returns before sending the products back to Amazon.? Any business that needs to establish a U.S.-based location to help make wholesale buying, shipping, and financial arrangements easier.? Companies and individuals that want to buy goods from U.S. retailers online that will not ship overseas or consumers that wish to complete all their U.S. purchases before shipping internationally in order to save money. We have shipping agents located all over the U.S., and they keep our logistics network running. The decentralized operations help us save money by removing the need for central warehouses and facilities. Instead, our shipping agents work from the comfort of their own home or office, giving them flexibility and us the ability to pass the savings onto our clients. How the Process Works? Clients are provided with a real U.S. address. This address corresponds to one of our U.S. shipping agents.? Once the products are shipped, they are delivered to the address of the shipping agent. The agent will post photos of the outer packaging to the online platform. If there are any special instructions for product handling, the agent then takes care of the requests, such inspection, re-packaging, consolidation.? Then the agent uses a private shipping label provided by our company to ship the package to the customer. Duties? Be available at your address to receive orders Monday through Friday, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. There may be times when agents will be required to leave their location to pick up products from stores or the post office.? Check in with your supervisor regularly through the employee portal.? Be able to receive as many as five letters a day.? Practice and maintain safety, privacy, and quality standards.? Be detailed in product condition assessment, when preparing reports or taking photos to verify packages.? Professionally prepare and distribute packages for shipping in a manner that keeps the items in brand-new condition.? Ship packages from one of the company's shipping partners: USPS, FedEx, or UPS. Requirements? A valid U.S. address. It may be either a home or business address.? Reliable transportation for large packages or multiple packages.? Be capable of lifting heavy or bulk packages up to 30 pounds.? Have reliable Internet as well as a computer and printer. Agents are responsible for supplying their own equipment.? The ability to work independently and stay self-motivated. We prefer employees that are driven, ambitious, and great at self-managing in return for a work-at-home career.? Must be able to pass a background check. We take the responsibility of handling our clients our  purchases very seriously, as well as their privacy. Compensation Our shipping agents receive $3,500 per month through direct deposit or PayPal. The first payment will be sent out after the first full month of work, as a security measure to guarantee our clients some  property safety. After the first full month, payments are made twice a month. We also report your work expenses, including shipping materials, gas, and Internet costs upon submission of expense report. There is no investment on your part. We will send you a W-2 form each year which will outline the taxes that have been raised. How to Start the Application Process Our shipping agents have lucrative careers that let them work from the comfort of their own homes. If you are interested in the Shipping Agent position and feel like it would fit your lifestyle, complete the online application through this link, and start the process today. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ecGeM-NfJOAVv5Zm9xezteMdiPlei7VN8hN9tRawt88/ We will let you know within a week if we find your candidacy to be suitable for this position. Responses to requests about the position may take up to a week to be processed. If you have any questions, please reply to this email, or call us at: 407-627-1638. 2014, Jeff Walters, sales department, Premium Logistics USA Corp. SECOND EMAIL : We have reviewed your application. We are ready to get you on board, but on condition of another period of one month. This measure allows us to check in practice if a person is really capable of being a high performer in the remote work environment. During the training period our company will provide you on-the-job training. Your ability to perform the duties in accordance with the requirements of the training program will be evaluated by your supervisor. In the end of this period, you will receive a written confirmation which will inform you about the outcome of your training and your performance. During this period, you will earn $30 for every processed and dispatched package. These payments can made twice per month or more often upon your request. If you demonstrate personal motivation and high performance levels during the probation, you will have senior status and will be considered a senior employee with a salary of $3.500 a month. I hope you will find this necessary clause acceptable for you. The next step is to get your hiring documents processed. Please log in with the information provided below. In your account you will find your payment agreement. You will need to complete and submit the agreement and W-4 form through your account in order to get started. You can access your account through the following link: https://www.logistics-station.com/ Note:        Password:       Once we have your signed paperwork, you will be able to get acquainted with a comprehensive Shipping Agent manual in your account. We assume that you have carefully read the entire list of your duties and responsibilities, which you can find in the employment agreement. As soon as we process your documents, your supervisor will contact you to go over of your daily tasks and responsibilities in more detail. We hope you will love this opportunity. If you have any problems or something seems unclear, please feel free to contact us via e-mail or call 727-677-9140. -- 2000, Jeff Walters, Premium Logistics USA, Corp. She said they would submit my resume to client - did NOT ask for right to represent as most do (hint #1).  Within a few days, on a Saturday afternoon I got a text and email saying client was very interested and in the email it said, "We have got feedback of your choice which we have submit to the Client. they have selected your profile and eager to get you on board. but they have mentioned a small bump in your profile, they required Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certificate as mentioned in the job description.You can go through the basic program as when you start working with the client, any kind of advance training will be provided by them on there end. Kindly send us this certificate(in process also acceptable). if you don't have so please find below online institutes links for the Lean Sixty Green Belt Certification needed as per the job description. You can choose the best option. please send us the enrollment request so that we can submit to the Client." (Hint #2) I researched the link in the email and found nothing about " https://academyelearn.com/course/lean-six-sigma-green-belt/"  So I went online - found an accredited Lean Sixty Certificate class, etc.  I sent that paid email for a class with SSGI (it was also much cheaper and provided a minimal discount code and processed like more payment sites)  The people would NOT accept this.  She responded via text and email.  Here's the response via email:  "As we discussed, SSGI is not acceptable by Nokia. You can go with the recommended institute by them.You can directly contact the institute for the discount offers as well. https://academyelearn.com/course/lean-six-sigma-green-belt/ Thanks! 1" (hint #3) I went to this site and asked if the $299 fee was acceptable and they said NO.  Recruiter had also mentioned a discount code so I asked the messenger if there was a discount code.  The messenger said no but would send me an.  I could not pay on the site (huh?? hint #4)  So I got the message about 15 minutes later via email. Meanwhile, I called the editor back, asking general broad questions about how the interview process works, etc. and got not response from my questions.  Instead, she said I needed to get the results from the link (online) and she would then continue "the process" - no details as to what the process was.  I did not pay for the "service" and although I got a few more texts from the secretary tell me we had to get this paid in to the client that day, have not heard back from her since.
I have been applying to jobs in the South Bend area since about March so when I received an email from Acme Consulting about an employment opportunity I was excited! The only problem was that I didn't apply there. The email had me sign up for a video interview slot which I did and I sent an email to the editor to confirm. My reason that this job was a job was their lack of presence on Twitter, social media and their generic website. A marketing agency should have a very active presence. Then I found this last review that sealed the deal in convincing me to ignore all future forms of contact: https://www.yelp.com/biz/roked-south-bend
Part time job 300 weekly if you have a car,truck,vehicle or bike it will not damage your paint. Paid to die for a beer. Once you apply that's when the worst happens they mail you a bad check for $1959.46 to deposit into your account then they say a technician will come to your house to apply the check and you're to pay them cash from the deposited check.
Provide a description of the incident and how you were treated. Provide information not captured elsewhere in this complaint form. I applied to a job on Indeed for an Executive Assistant position at a company called Allied Health. About a week or so later I was contacted via my associated email address with an offer for an interview and documentation on the company and the position. I was given instructions on how to proceed by setting up a profile on Wire.com and to connect with someone named "Tiffany Chu". I did this and she set up an interview time for me. She interviewed me entirely via chat, which I thought was strange. She said they would get back to me within a week. I was contacted a little after a week and offered the position and given more information about the operations of the company, the structure of the training process and expectations for the first two weeks. On Monday 8/3/2020 I began what they called "Pre-Training" with a woman named Emma Tabenkin. This all took place via wire and consisted mostly of testing my writing and communication skills. It all seemed very above board. It proceeded the same on 8/4/2020 at first and then took a sharp turn. They had told me previously that as a work remote position they helped with setting up a home office location and they would be sending funds so I could get it set up. On Tuesday (8/4) I was asked to print 2 checks and mobile deposit them so I could purchase the software/security system "online". Despite my irritation at the start of the process I got it done. Immediately they asked me about whether it was deposited. Then they asked me to proceed buying the software. This is where it gets really strange. I was asked to purchase 5 gift cards, from Nordstrom totaling the amount of $2215. I was persuaded into doing this by being forced into going to several different stores until I found them. They then asked me to send them pictures of the cards. I am sorry to say I did all of these things despite my extreme discomfort. It felt wrong and I felt extremely rushed into completing these tasks. I asked them many times to explain why I was doing this and told them many times I was tired and uncomfortable doing it. Emma Tabenkin said we could just pick up the next day, seeing my discomfort. Today I have done nothing but speak to them privately and research if this is a possible case. My bank froze my account today (8/5/2020). I haven't received confirmation on the information there quite yet but they are looking into the situation. (2) checks were mobile deposited totaling $4499.00 and $4490.00 respectively. I was then asked to purchase $2215 worth of Nordstrom gift cards which were broken out like this: (4) $500 (1) $215 At this point I have only really communicated with them until today but they continue to try and reach me via phone. Mainly with listed at the number 347-518-8023 I have possession of all of this communication as well as every gift and gift card still saved.
Reached out through 3rd party agency for employment. Extremely vague interview process claiming they have huge clients yet could not state what they really did. Address location does not have a legal business name and is listed incorrectly or inconsistent with the company that reached out.
I was texted by a random number. Following a couple and conversation to send me a check to buy an computer and software for my job to make.
I worked for this company for almost 2 months with no pay. I was told that my job was to inspect incoming packages and review them using the label that they would provide. I'm am afraid that I have been used as part of a credit card fraud operations.

I found the company on an employment search site while looking for a remote job during COVID-19. I was freshly out of college and was looking for full-time employment. I ended up getting contacted by Mitch Benson to get an interview. He sent over the interview questions as well as the work contract to give an idea of my responsibilities and the rules of the company. My mother and I had done prior research on the computer to make sure it was clean and the website and information we had found was secure. Some time had passed and I had gotten "hired," I had given them my bank routing number and account number to set up my direct deposit, they had informed me that the first few checks they would send to me would be paper until they could get my direct deposit set up. I had to purchase equipment for the job and was done through a "private vendor," I had to buy little things like phones, work laptop, a printer and other things needed to do my job. I had informed them I did not have the money up front to pay so they said they will give me the money to purchase the equipment. Then they had sent me a total of three checks in the mail and shortly after that a withdrawal that I did not make was made and my account was over $1,400 I was able to pay it off.
FIRST EMAIL : My department hr@premiumlogisticsusa.com via sendgrid.net Friday, Jul 24, 12:52 PM (12 days ago) to me Shipping Agent position We appreciate your interest in joining our company. Below, you you ll find the details of the Shipping Agent position outlined, along with the expected duties and an explanation of our hiring procedure. Premium Logistics USA is a tech-enabled third-party logistics company which provides online mail management and e-commerce logistics solutions. Our innovative approach to shipping gives our customers access to a large network of U.S. suppliers and retail partners in addition to the best shipping rates we can negotiate. Starting logistics operations in the U.S. can often be complex, but our selection process makes setting international distribution easy. Here are just a few examples of who our clients are:? International companies that buy products from U.S. suppliers for distribution in other countries and need their products prepared and consolidated before shipping internationally in order to meet foreign import regulations.? Amazon states that, according to Amazon regulations, need to have their products inspected and prepared according to guidelines before sending their products to Amazon customer centers.? Amazon stores that need inspection and processing of their buyer returns before sending the products back to Amazon.? Any business that needs to establish a U.S.-based location to help make wholesale buying, shipping, and financial arrangements easier.? Companies and individuals that want to buy goods from U.S. retailers online that will not ship overseas or consumers that wish to complete all their U.S. purchases before shipping internationally in order to save money. We have shipping agents located all over the U.S., and they keep our logistics network running. The decentralized operations help us save money by removing the need for central warehouses and facilities. Instead, our shipping agents work from the comfort of their own home or office, giving them flexibility and us the ability to pass the savings onto our clients. How the Process Works? Clients are provided with a real U.S. address. This address corresponds to one of our U.S. shipping agents.? Once the products are shipped, they are delivered to the address of the shipping agent. The agent will post photos of the outer packaging to the online platform. If there are any special instructions for product handling, the agent then takes care of the requests, such inspection, re-packaging, consolidation.? Then the agent uses a private shipping label provided by our company to ship the package to the customer. Duties? Be available at your address to receive orders Monday through Friday, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. There may be times when agents will be required to leave their location to pick up products from stores or the post office.? Check in with your supervisor regularly through the employee portal.? Be able to receive as many as five letters a day.? Practice and maintain safety, privacy, and quality standards.? Be detailed in product condition assessment, when preparing reports or taking photos to verify packages.? Professionally prepare and distribute packages for shipping in a manner that keeps the items in brand-new condition.? Ship packages from one of the company's shipping partners: USPS, FedEx, or UPS. Requirements? A valid U.S. address. It may be either a home or business address.? Reliable transportation for large packages or multiple packages.? Be capable of lifting heavy or bulk packages up to 30 pounds.? Have reliable Internet as well as a computer and printer. Agents are responsible for supplying their own equipment.? The ability to work independently and stay self-motivated. We prefer employees that are driven, ambitious, and great at self-managing in return for a work-at-home career.? Must be able to pass a background check. We take the responsibility of handling our clients our  purchases very seriously, as well as their privacy. Compensation Our shipping agents receive $3,500 per month through direct deposit or PayPal. The first payment will be sent out after the first full month of work, as a security measure to guarantee our clients some  property safety. After the first full month, payments are made twice a month. We also report your work expenses, including shipping materials, gas, and Internet costs upon submission of expense report. There is no investment on your part. We will send you a W-2 form each year which will outline the taxes that have been raised. How to Start the Application Process Our shipping agents have lucrative careers that let them work from the comfort of their own homes. If you are interested in the Shipping Agent position and feel like it would fit your lifestyle, complete the online application through this link, and start the process today. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ecGeM-NfJOAVv5Zm9xezteMdiPlei7VN8hN9tRawt88/ We will let you know within a week if we find your candidacy to be suitable for this position. Responses to requests about the position may take up to a week to be processed. If you have any questions, please reply to this email, or call us at: 407-627-1638. 2014, Jeff Walters, sales department, Premium Logistics USA Corp. SECOND EMAIL : We have reviewed your application. We are ready to get you on board, but on condition of another period of one month. This measure allows us to check in practice if a person is really capable of being a high performer in the remote work environment. During the training period our company will provide you on-the-job training. Your ability to perform the duties in accordance with the requirements of the training program will be evaluated by your supervisor. In the end of this period, you will receive a written confirmation which will inform you about the outcome of your training and your performance. During this period, you will earn $30 for every processed and dispatched package. These payments can made twice per month or more often upon your request. If you demonstrate personal motivation and high performance levels during the probation, you will have senior status and will be considered a senior employee with a salary of $3.500 a month. I hope you will find this necessary clause acceptable for you. The next step is to get your hiring documents processed. Please log in with the information provided below. In your account you will find your payment agreement. You will need to complete and submit the agreement and W-4 form through your account in order to get started. You can access your account through the following link: https://www.logistics-station.com/ Note:        Password:       Once we have your signed paperwork, you will be able to get acquainted with a comprehensive Shipping Agent manual in your account. We assume that you have carefully read the entire list of your duties and responsibilities, which you can find in the employment agreement. As soon as we process your documents, your supervisor will contact you to go over of your daily tasks and responsibilities in more detail. We hope you will love this opportunity. If you have any problems or something seems unclear, please feel free to contact us via e-mail or call 727-677-9140. -- 2000, Jeff Walters, Premium Logistics USA, Corp. I have all documents fulfilled, and I want before to send you it, be safe with my personal data,  and I want to ask you your business licenses because I want to check the business legitimate, because I will sending very sensitive information. You can share it with me? Thank you very much for your response and thanks in advanced interview THEN THEY STOPPED THE EMAIL CONTACT WITH ME AND OF COURSE THEY NOT SEND ANY BUSINESS CREDENTIALS

I was contacted by a Brendan Walsh from Optimus Rides on July 27, 2020 saying his company saw my resume online and wanted to know if I was interested in joining his company as a US Representative. I replied yes and I was requested to have an online interview with Brendan through the Facebook App. I conducted a 1 on 1 interview with Brendan and he replied the next day July 28, 2020 stating that the company wanted to offer me the GM position. It did send an email with a new form and offer letter welcoming me to the company. I did fill out the form with my name and SSN plus my DOB. Brendan then proceeded to have a company check sent to me via USPS to purchase work from home computer equipment I would need to perform my job duties. Once I received the check I deposited into my bank account on July 30, 2020. I was notified by my bank (Santander Bank) on July 31, 2020 that my account was on hold due to the fraud department checking on the validity of the check that was sent to me. I looked at my bank account through my app on August 4, 2020 and saw an alert stating the check had been returned as a savings item and I was charged $15 as a returned check fee to my account. When I attempted to reach Brendan Walsh regarding this issue, I got no response. I then contacted my bank's fraud department for more information. They confirmed to me that the check was not a real check and that they are conducting an ongoing investigation and that my credit card is frozen pending further review. I went to my local Police Department and filed a Police Report regarding identity theft.
I applied for a job with mail delivery service providers via Facebook and received a video interview invite from  Sir Paul Brundage.   I had the interview with him and there was one other person in the interview area. A few days later I received an offer with multiple email accounts to fill out. This was July 6th and in the email they said that I must respond with the filled out paperwork before July 7th. I did so and provided all my information including my drivers license and  photos of my social security card. They said In these emails that they would be setting up a background check with me and drug screening. I provided all the necessary information and weeks went by and still no answer as to if I Officially got the job being that I had received the offer letter July 6th. On July 20th I am  to Paul Brundage.  and he said he hadn't heard anything yet. It is now Class 4th and I have given up on this job and called  to Paul Brundage,  and told him I was withdrawing myself from consideration and no response back. I then started work research into this company .  Tree City Transport had and couldn't find any information on the web and I found an address in one of the emails and the place was in danger.
A text message came in asking me to start a little account with a MrHunterWorkman@gmail.com from Osmosis - Knowledge Diffusion. They said they found my resume on Indeed/ Linkedin and that I might be a good fit for a remote data entry position. There is a Hunter Hunter listed on the Osmosis website as a result. After asking me some general interview questions, they said I was a good fit, although it didn't seem right. The person never asked for my resume, details were changing, and there were many grammar and pronunciation errors and other strange things about it such as saying my supervisor would be a Mr. Shirley Tigner. They said a check would come to me so that I could purchase the office equipment that would be needed to set up my home work station. I contacted Osmosis - Knowledge Diffusion and they haven't gotten back to me yet. They asked for my bank name (I declined) and also asked for my general information (name, address, phone, email) after they "offered" me the job so that they could give it to their "secretary's department."

They then proceeded to send me a check for $2,100 to deposit into my bank account. This was to purchase software for a computer they were going to send me to use for work. Then they continually asked if the funds were available. When I told them no they then asked if I had credit cards and I said no. When I asked about the wrong address on the check they would not answer the question. When I told them the funds were available they then instructed me to purchase some play cards. That was when I told them I knew they were a team.

I received a call with a woman's voice saying she saw that I had been on a job search site recently (which I had been on several), the phone then made a static noise and she said, "Can you hear me okay?" I replied, "yes." Then she rattled off information that she is a job search consultant, or something like that, and a phone number, so fast that I couldn't understand what was said. Then the call cut off, and I realized I had just been called, talked into saying "yes" to something. I called the number back and received the exact same recording. But now when I call the number I get a recording telling me to push 1 if I live in California and 2 if I don't. Of course I just hung up. I"m just sick over this. I've heard of these types of games, but fell for it so easily. I only answered the unknown number because I just started a new job and thought it might be them. I'm worried about what is going to happen as a result of this. The questions below ask if I lost money or information, but I don't know yet.
A promise of a work at home job with great pay. If that sounds to good to be true it is. They make it sound very easy by charging you with an interview over the phone. Even going as far as making a w-9 for you to sign. The job itself has you logging into a database and tracking packages that get delivered to your address.
I am looking for a new job. I have received several text/emails about job offers. Now this one from the financial, Sallie R. Larsen, from Sallielarsen48@gmail.com, about a AP position she received my resume on one of the sites I added it to I did an interview using the pages which I have used before.  She begin to tell me about the job. I asked basic questions and we did an online Interview  She then came  back and said I am hired it is a strictly working from and they provide all equipment.  I did question this and both myself and my husband looked into the company seemed like the name really is it. I did say to my husband that this sounds to good to be true. We then both decide let it play out. They sent me a check and before I could I made sure it posted to my account. The next day I was then asked to send a portion to there order guy for part of my equipment. I did that. And about 2 hours later the money I deposited was reversed out and my account is now minus 999.00 the check was for 2,310.00.   My bank was contacted and a investigation is being opened. Bottom Line is these people are good I even asked at one point is this for real she then sent me info a long message about the company. And on the website this is how the company has employees. I should of stuck to my instinct and not have fallen for this.   This is  a part of my connection with this and . - This branch recruiting is located at 75 State Street, 22nd Floor. Boston, MA 02109, " This is strictly an online and work from home job the working hours are flexible and you can choose to work from home or anywhere of your choice...Okay? Yes correct. I keep receiving some checks from Anthony Hall claiming to be with Full Circle (a legitimate business that pays you to wrap your vehicle with ads). I have received 2 checks now for $4600 from Wells Fargo, but when I called Full Circle to confirm they said Anthony Hall is not an employee and that they don't send out checks like that.
I received a random text message with this heading:  A $500 JOB PAYMENT.  I've attached a copy of the Full text message. This fact is that they inform you that Blue Bell Ice Cream (LLC) is paying individuals who own a vehicle $500 a week to register for you via  your Vinyl Decalter  attached to your vehicle. It goes on to request personal information. I reached out to his  and  they said it was NOT affiliated with them in any way  and  have received  no and but  from others who received the same message. They further advised me to NOT RESPOND to the text or open any pages etc. They also referred me to this website  and  encouraged me to report to appropriate authorities! Very helpful! It hits me that in these trying financial times for a lot of years, that country will prey upon the vulnerable! There will be a lot of people who fall victim to this (I assume eventual Identity Theft) and without checking it's legitimacy! PLEASE WARN FAMILY, FRIENDS, LOVED-ONES, Elderly etc! Be Safe, ALWAYS check Too-Good-To-Be-True offers... they're USUALLY just that!

on June 19th 2020 i signed a contract stating i would earn $2200 monthly base pay plus bonus, i was to receive packages and inspect and take pictures of the product and then the company would send me a pre-paid shipping label and I would re-pack the merchandise and ship it out using the provided shipping label
I got an email from this "company" around June 17, 2020. They claimed I applied to one of their positions from the Indeed job board or they found my resume on indeed, I can't remember which. They seemed legitimate, they have a physical address and a phone number. They called me and explained the job was very simple, which was to basically receive packages to my house and to remove the labels, label them with the labels they had, and ship them through UPS, FedEx, etc. When they came (they offered a generous amount of money for the little work I did) nothing came in and suddenly, they stopped answering phone calls, and they did not respond to emails. I did some further digging in this type of work and it turns out that these false companies, or dealers, use innocent peoples' addresses to have stolen goods shipped to them and then destroyed so that the items are not traced back to them. They seemed legitimate up until the end. I wasted 6 weeks in what I may get in trouble for. If it seems too good to be true or if it seems in any way right, trust your gut, please. I was smart enough to keep record of the original labels and other information. Do not fall for these words!

They sent me a check to get the supplies I needed to start work. All happening within days. I had not clue about stuff like this, I thought it was weird. My bank later restricted my card after receiving my check! I told the  local employer that  the check was fake  and  they blocked me. Yes my bank deposited the fake check  and  I told them I was and  and  they took my money still.   Don you t get a cause if the bank takes the fake check they will blame you  and  not help you! These people use telegraph, never use telephone!!

They interview you to out, hire you, then send you a "check for equipment you're supposed to deposit into your own bank account. Next, they'll ask you for proof, a screen shot of the deposit. Since it'll have to be a mobile deposit the "check" will take a few days to deposit so they ask you to front the money up front. I told them no and the next day the check bounced. I dug for an hour trying to find info on it until I called the building itself. Thats when I got the full name, instead of AFA Security. Ali put me on hold for 2 minutes and came back and said "Jeff Jimenez, Manager" I asked, Manager of what? Training, Training, Recruitment. Ali couldnot answer. My name is               , I will be your personal manager. Some of our customers from the USA are only able to send the payment locally by the US banker's check. That's why we need a Administrative Assistant in the USA to process payments from our clients. The job is part-time and requires 2-3 hours a day. You will receive payments from our clients at your email address weekly, get your commission and forward the funds to our representative office by Money gram. Usually there will be 5-6 races per week. Once the check arrives, your supervisor will contact you and assign your tasks for the day and will give you instructions on sending the money to our company representative office. Your commission will be included along with every payment. We will let you know how much of the same amount is your commission and the amount that has to be transferred. All payment processing fees are collected instantly and derived from the amount received. We also pay all tax expenses and transportation fees. Your starting salary will consist of $2000 regular monthly payment + 5 percent commission, which is derived from each transaction made during the training period. Total income, considering the current volume of clients, will be about $500 per month. Each Administrative Assistant is provided with employment benefits after successful completion of any period (30 days). The employment benefits include: - Retirement Options  - Health  and  Dental insurance  - Professional development programs Please, kindly fill the application form and sign up the agreement (attached to this message). You don't need to invest your own money to get started. We also don't ask any secure details from you. We will contact you in 24 hours as soon as we receive signed documents. Our clients will start sending letters at your mail address in about 3-5 days after we receive your acceptance and completed application/agreement forms. Now the function of the accounting software is to arrange, organize and manage the data you have processed, sent to your supervisor via e-mail. I found her name on the list of team members and then at the end of the conversation told I was hired. I looked at the website to try and find a number to call to confirm its legitimacy but all I found were emails. It was a legitimate company, I called the address that I found two separate times on the website to confirm the job offer I was then instructed to add a different person on Skype and chat with him because he was going to give me my assignments to do as part of my training. His name was "Denise Arnold". He said I would need to order software and equipment from their company vendor and they would send me a check in the mail to pay for these materials as soon as possible. This was a real company with real people, but the people that I was talking to was not them. they were just posing as the people that they got off of the real websites team page. Got accepted for a  " Quality Control Inspector" position supposedly affiliated with Amazon. I didn't get far in the process before a lot of red flags started coming up (low quality phone interview, unusual company names, odd document formats for contracts, companies not easily signed, it showed company as Not Rated, etc.). Didn't apply for this company, but applied for a Mailman job under a different company on Twitter which they cited as the source of my resume in the acceptance email. (Also just got notified of a job posting with the same exact description under another company on Facebook). Caution: They will start by asking for public info, but will try to gather banking info during direct deposit setup. If you don't they 'n't push. However, others who have dealt with this same scenario say the company will follow-up with training or program costs of $2,400. If you agreed for your check by mail it'll simply disappear or they'll ghost you once they get the training money.

I have not had any official discussions with this person yet since I have already been contacted by a similar number.  This "Company" spoke of a work at home Customer Service/Data Entry position paying $35.00 per hour - something similar to the first position offered which I have previously reported to you. Both advised they had found my info on Careerbuilder.com.  They only have my name, address, phone number and email address - all publicly available info that would be available on my posted resume.
We received your application and would love to interview you about the available Virtual Assistant Job position at home, your direct response will be deeply appreciated Please follow the interview instructions below as soon as you can. Duties and Responsibilities Respond to emails and phone calls, Schedule meetings, Book travel and information, Manage a contact list, Prepare customer requests and keep online records,Organize managers to  and Tracks data and source documents. Prepares and sorts source documents, and identifies and stores data to be entered. examines, sorts and measures data for accuracy. Contacts responsible parties or clients from other organization to resolve moderately complex questions, inconsistencies This company offers medical and dental insurance, long-term disability,sick leave, life insurance, 401K, and profit sharing are available.The pay for this position is $30.55 an hour, please follow the interview instructions below as soon as you can. INTERVIEW INSTRUCTIONS The interview is virtual,the interview is via instant message on right now, If you are using your laptop, then you might have to proceed to the main website(google.com/chat) and if you are using a mobile phone you might have to download the app app on your phone, Once that is done, Please Invite Mrs Gabriella Makayla, the Research  and  Recruitment officer for GRAPHCORE on Gmail Hangout by simply typing her email address to the add icon on page or search box (gabriellamakayla869@gmail.com), Message her stating you are available and ready for the interview, she is online and would respond to you for sure, just hold online, this is out first step to proceed further, she would be expecting to hear from you soon she said was going to forward the conversation to a hiring manager to get me hired. She said I would be working from home and would need these supplies, 4 in one (card, printer, computer and printer), a, Bar-code printer and cards, 4 drawer cabinet and office keys, HP Pavilion HDX18-1180US 18.4-Inch Laptop (with Intel Core 2 and Core Processor, 4 GB RAM, 500 GB Hard Drive, Blu-ray Drive, Video Premium) Oracle Complete Accounting Software, MarkS for Windows Accounting Software, MYOB Business Essentials Accounting Software, QuickBooks Pro Accounting Software and a Time Tracker. They were going to cut me a check and mail it to me overnight to buy all the materials and then send over the new information. They sent a professional looking check of $5965.00 to me that I got the next morning. I contacted the bank it was issued from and they confirmed that it was a fake check I let  to have do  know and she said it was my fault I didn't wait for instructions and blocked further contact with me.
I have read about a similar act performed on someone else.  I received an email from the address shown asking me to meet the "hiring manager" on the account.  He used the name MartyMiller8000 - I wondered why he didn't use a more professional name, and he spoke broken English, so I did not believe Marty Miller was his real name.  I went through an interview process and was offered a work at home position making $35 an hour immediately - that's when I became suspicious.  I checked the same website earlier and found the similar complaint.  I am to meet "Mr Jones" tomorrow AM on some Earth.  I was since approached by a similar man via text message to my phone - I will report this one immediately.
I applied for a paid marketing internship on LinkedIn early in early June 2020 with the company Global Beat. On July 21, 2020, I received an email informing me that I had been granted an initial interview. The interview took place via Zoom, lasted about 10 minutes, and consisted of an alleged member of their management team pitching the company. Four other soldiers were present. After the interview, a question was sent to my email. I received a text message from the company asking me to complete the questionnaire immediately if I wanted to be considered for the position. The questions asked for my full name name, highest level of education, expected graduation date, phone number, home address, job, interests, and why I was interested in marketing. I submitted the questionnaire and received another email a couple hours later asking for a secondary interview. The secondary interview also took place over Zoom with another alleged member of their management team. The interview proceeded to describe the company's work culture, its history, its goals, and the duties expected of an owner. The description of the company seemed too good to be true and was extremely vague. Global Beat claimed that they would train and educate me in marketing while paying me anywhere from $300 to $500 a week. The only job qualification was that applicants be older than 18 years of age. All questions I asked were answered with "If you are chosen for the position, the management team will provide you with more details." Afterwards, I received an email and a phone call from an alleged CIA representative, asking me to schedule a final interview for later that afternoon. This final interview lasted five minutes, took place via phone, and was with the alleged management team member that I met with in the first interview. The only question asked was how I became interested in marketing. The attorney said that I had been granted the position and that I should come to their office the next morning to undergo a background check. I was told to bring my Social Security Card and my driver's license. A couple hours later, I received another call from the operator from the secondary interview to confirm the in person meeting the following day. That night, I was concerned that this job with Global Beat might be a mistake. It was odd that they knew absolutely nothing about me other than my names, my home address, my phone number, and the generic information on my LinkedIn profile, yet they granted me the job. None of the interviews were truly interviews - rather, the writers consistently tried to pitch the company to investors. When I looked up their website, the website looked professional but was incredibly vague. Additionally, when I turned the app into a website designed to show when a website was created, their page was created on June 3, 2020. This was a couple days before the job listing appeared on LinkedIn. Additionally, in my second interview, the publisher claimed that the company was founded in Jacksonville, FL, back in 2017, expanded into Atlanta, GA, shortly after, and had just opened its Tampa branch back in January of 2019. These dates did not agree with the fact that their website was supposedly created in 2020. Furthermore, I could find no information whatsoever on Global Beat branches in Jacksonville or Tampa. I did not show up to the in person meeting. I did, however, drive to their address on George Road and found the suite number they gave me (suite 130). There was no Global Beat company to be found. Instead, I found the firm Florida Engineering and Environmental Services, INC., a company that lists the same address and suite number on their own website. I have blocked all numbers they used to call or text me, and have not received any other emails.

Salary: Fixed $1200/ monthly + 40$ bonus for every package. Average monthly income $2800.  For Residents Only. Received email about job interview.  Found in a gene.  But also found no cases after accepting and research.  Original contact from company was to my email account.
I am glad to welcome you as the newest member of G-MARKETPLACE (Global Marketplace)! Please CLICK HERE to start by creating your own online control panel account. Make sure you submit all of your details correctly  including the address apartment number (if available). Your new account will be approved within 1-2 business days and you will receive a confirmation email. Once your account is approved, please log in and devote your time and attention to examine all of the available sections. The  Self Help Group  section will provide basic instructions on how to operate and process the assigned tasks. All assigned tasks must be completed within a 24 hour time frame. Once you read the instructions in your account, please download a scan or photo of your valid government issued ID to your account (this is required for identification). It is mandatory to log in from a room in order to gain access to all of the available functions of the control panel. You will be receiving instructions when new tasks will be assigned  however, it is important to log in at least 3 times per day to stay updated and to confirm the completed tasks, since your training period performance is being evaluated. Your first tasks will be assigned in the next few business days and your training period starts officially after your first log in to your online control panel account. For general assistance you can always call your supervisor Avi Grossman (213) 344-during working hours. Your team leader Maricela Sosa will assign new tasks and answer your task related questions in the online control panel'slicing system. I will be reviewing and evaluating your overall progress during the 31 day paid vacation period. When I ask about completing the 1099 they called me immediately and told me that I would have to wait until it's time for work. My gut felt like something was wrong. They owe me for the packages that I did process.  $180 plus the salary.
This fake company seemed to be legitimate.  I applied on Career Builder.  I had a phone interview with the City Manager and they sent me an agreement to sign and requested a copy of my driver's license.  I was very hesitate to sign the agreement and I had multiple conversations with him about the company before I sent them back the signed agreement.  I even watched a video of the process and how the company operated.  They set me up with a Dashboard to keep track of all incoming and outgoing packages.  I was supposed to be paid on 7/23/20 by direct deposit and never received anything into my account.  I have called and left messages and emails and have not gotten a response from anyone.  When I try to call accounting, it says they are having technical difficulties.  I can no longer log into my Facebook account so I'm assuming they blocked it or disabled it.
